texts.en:
Ester is a 19-year-old woman from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. There, she teaches life skills to students and serves as a role model. She says that she is a source of inspiration to young people in her community because she is so determined to succeed. 

Ester operates a grocery tuck-shop at her local business centre, where she sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks. If profits allow, Ester hopes to expand her business into a larger store. Easter also aims to become more financially stable and support her family. She is interested in assisting vulnerable children in her community, as well. Ester will use the Kiva loan to purchase cartons of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks in bulk to boost sales.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks in bulk to boost sales.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kinobi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She has five children with one of them currently in school. For the past 13 years, Safina has been working hard to manage her small food business which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of maize flour and beans to sell and will help Safina to generate greater profits to take care of her family's basic needs. 

Safina hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Safina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of maize flour and beans for sale

loans.name: Mico Salasala Group

texts.en:
Renatha, a mother of three kids, one schooling and the rest still young, is in her thirties. She is a businesswoman running a fish business, a business she has been with for five years.

Renatha wakes early in the morning on the way to the fish market, purchases fish, cleans them, and then fries them so they are ready for sale. She ends work at 10 p.m. and is able to make a good return each month. 

She is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Mico Salasala, a group with 10 members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Renatha will use this loan to buy a stock of fish for her business. Her ambitions are to greatly improve her family life and get her kids to a better school.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Africa Romano 2 Group

texts.en:
Nereida is the coordinator of her group Africa Romano 2 (Roman Africa). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to make her small business a successful one. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her family moments.

Nereida is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and having grown her business. Her business, which she started more than six years ago with some savings, is selling different local fruit and vegetables. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying yucca, plantains, bananas, sweet potatoes, carrots, potatoes and others goods.

Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water, none of which is potable, and unreliable electricity. Nereida thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Primrose

texts.en:
Primrose is an 18-year-old businesswoman from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. Her family relies on her and her mother's business as the only source of income. 

Primrose sells sugar, rice, tea, body creams, sanitary wear, washing powders, and soap at her shop. She serves as a peer educator in her community and a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. 

With the Kiva loan, she will make bulk purchases of her products to reduce her costs and increase profits. This will stabilize her business and make it easier to support her family.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of her products to reduce her costs and increase profits.

loans.name: Previous

texts.en:
Previous is a 36-year-old young woman. She is married and is currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Learner Guide at her local secondary school where on a weekly basis she runs a life skills class. 

Over the last year, she has grown her sewing business to produce about 40 items every week. She sells products such as duvet covers, clothing, toilet covers, and seat covers to local residents.

Previous would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to other markets. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more sewing materials to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing material

loans.name: Antonio De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonio, compro con el crédito anterior diferentes estilos de ropa,  con lo que satisface los gustos de sus clientes y adquirió insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz teniendo como resultado una cosecha abundante, ha optimizado las circunstancias familiares y cancelo su deuda.
En esta ocasión está solicitando más capital para invertirlo en su negocio, comprara abono, semilla, plaguicidas, fertilizantes, insecticidas y nuevos estilos de prendas de vestir, de esta forma fortalecer su negocio y seguirá trabajando.
texts.en: With his previous loan, Antonio bought different styles of clothing which are satisfying the tastes of his customers. He also acquired agricultural inputs to cultivate corn and had an abundant harvest as a result. He has optimized his family situation and cancelled his debt. On this occasion, he is requesting more capital to invest in his business. He will buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, insecticides and new styles of clothing in order to strengthen his business, and he will continue working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides and new styles of clothing

loans.name: Esther De La Paz

texts.es:
Esther, sigue atendiendo su negocio de venta de jugos, refrescos y panes, con ayuda del financiamiento anterior logro comprar la materia prima para mantener la continuidad de su trabajo y ha tenido ganancias  con las que ha cubierto los compromisos que tiene.
Por la necesidad de invertir en el negocio y hacer mejores en su vivienda, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar naranjas, zanahorias, azúcar, pan, embutidos y una bomba para pozo, seguirá fortaleciendo el negocio para dar a su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Esther continues to work at her business, selling juices, sodas and breads.  With previous funding support, she was able to purchase raw material to maintain the continuity of her work and has had earnings that have covered the commitments she has.

Because of the need to invest in the business and make improvements in her home, she is applying for a new loan to buy oranges, carrots, sugar, bread, sausages and a well pump.

This will further strengthen the business to give her family a livelihood.

loans.use: to buy oranges, carrots, sugar, bread, sausages and a pump for the well.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is a 21-year-old businesswoman from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local school in order to improve students’ life and study skills. 

Marceline also sells groceries such as cooking oil, sugar, flour, and rice. However, she would like to expand her small business into a larger retail shop. 

She will use the requested Kiva loan to purchase groceries in large quantities and increase her stock levels. This will enable her to sell more merchandise and increase her profits. 

Marceline will use her increase in profits to live a better life and financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in large quantities and increase her stock.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula es soltera y no tiene hijos ella vive con su hermano y su cuñada. La familia vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino donde pagan un alquiler Paula se dedica al comercio pero también esta estudiando Ella necesita un credito para comprar una laptop que le facilite sus estudios Paula recibe ayuda de su hermano pero solo para los gastos del hogar, por eso Paula necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Paula is single and has no children. She lives with her brother and her sister-in-law.  The family lives in La Paz in a house of fine finish construction, where they pay rent.

Paula works in retail but she is also studying. She needs a loan to buy a laptop to facilitate her studies.

Paula receives help from her brother but only for household expenses, that is why Paula needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to facilitate her studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of sugar, flour, cooking oil, boxes of matches, and candles.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 20-year-old young woman. She is married and has one child. She is living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering every week by teaching study and life skills to students at her local school. She currently earns a living producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 

Martha wants to increase production to earn more money. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks and feed to increase her production. The additional income will help Martha and her family become more financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Juntos A Trabajar Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidian Rocio ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia también vende zapatos, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de textiles, negocio de venta de artesanía negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "WORK TOGETHER".  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and Cusco state.

The member is Rocio Lidian.  She is single, 43 years and has 2 children. The member works at her business selling clothes.  The woman also sells shoes, pants, shirts and polos.  She has several years in this business and is doing very well.  The dream of this member is having a store. The member requesting a loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

The members of the group are in photo they took the picture after the meeting.  The other members are in the business of selling textiles, selling groceries and the restaurant business.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream and through this process she undertakes to comply with the payment of her payment by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her child's room (painting the walls, buying a bed).

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a Kubo.financiero client and this is her story.

Ana is 59 years old. She is married and has three grown-up sons that are married. She lives with her husband and they own a house. Ana has a store in which she sells clothes, shoes, and other seasonal products. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more inventory. She says that she likes to offer a lot of options for her clients and that she always pays her loans on time. Ana has always worked in retail and she says that her biggest accomplishment is providing stability and helping her sons become independent.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 19-year-old woman from the Guruve District in Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization. She provides counselling services to young people facing challenges in her community as a Camfed Learner Guide. 

Caroline operates a grocery shop as well. She sells drinks, snacks, exercise books, pens, rulers, plastic/khaki covers, cooking oil, soap, and sugar in her shop. Caroline will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available. She hopes to grow the business to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of at-risk children in the community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 21-year-old young woman. She is married and currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering each week at her local secondary school running life and study skills sessions. Over the last year, she has grown her sewing business to its current capacity – producing about 30 items every week. 

Juliet would very much like to increase her sales volume and offer more items. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more sewing materials to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
José, trabaja en la crianza de ganado y cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 10 años, en un horario de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde; José es soltero, vive en una casa familiar junto su madre y hermanos, por el momento no ha tenido dificultades en realizar esta actividad.
Invertirá en la compra de concentrado para ganado, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas para la milpa, esto será de ayuda para alimentar su ganado y aumentar la cosecha de sus cultivos, espera tener mejores ganancias seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos del hogar y respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Su sueño es ahorrar lo suficiente para construir su casa propia y poder independizarse.
texts.en:
Jose has been raising livestock and basic grains for 10 years.  His daily schedule is from 6:00 in the morning to 2:00 in the afternoon.  Jose is single, lives in the family home with his mother and siblings.  To date has had no difficulty performing this activity.

He will buy concentrate for livestock, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides to treat the cornfield.  This will be of help to feed his livestock and increase the harvest of his crops.  He expects better earnings and to continue to support his family's home expenses and pay back his loan.
.
His dream is to save enough to build his own home and become independent.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides to take care of the cornfield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stocks to improve sales.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Fatima tiene tres años de dedicarse a la actividad comercial venta de Ropa y Cosméticos, su esposo labora para una empresa privada, tiene un hijo quien asiste al colegio, ella solicita este crédito para la compra de Materiales de Construccion ya que realizara mejoras en la vivienda comprara Cemento para repellar la casa, cambiar la Puerta y unas laminas de Zinc. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado ya que su familia a salido adelante.
texts.en:
Fatima has been in business for three years selling clothing and cosmetics. Her husband works for a private company. She has a son who is at school.

Fatima is asking for this loan to buy building materials, as she is going to carry out some home improvements. She plans to buy cement for plastering the house, buy zinc sheets and replace the door.

She is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for the support they have given her, since her family has made progress.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yoro

texts.fr:
Yoro est un jeune débrouillard, marié et père de famille, qui s’active dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Il habite dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville. Il a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter de la marchandise : de la vaisselle, en plastique, verre, ou porcelaine. Yoro n’a pas encore un fond consistant pour ouvrir une cantine ou une boutique, c’est pourquoi il fait de l’ambulant. Il possède une clientèle fidèle qui fait la commande en cas de besoin.
Vivant en famille avec ses frères, Yoro participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Il aimerait voir son capital augmenter afin de pouvoir ouvrir une cantine, un jour et ne plus faire l’ambulant.
texts.en:
Yoro is a young resourceful man and a married father. He has been active in commerce for several years. He lives in a village located a few kilometers from town. He has need of a loan to purchase some merchandise:  dishes made of plastic, glass, or porcelain. Yoro still lacks substantial capital to open a stall or store. This is why he hawks his wares. He has a loyal customer base making special orders as needed. 

Living with his family including his brothers, Yoro helps to cover day-to-day household expenses. He would like to see his capital increase in order to be able to open a stall one day and to no longer sell door to door.

loans.use: to purchase dishes made of glass, porcelain, and plastic to resell

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis es un señor que vive con su esposa, cuenta Luis que en su juventud trabajo 8 años de empleado de carpintería y que después se propuso comprar herramienta para ponerse su negocio propio, pero que día a día va adecuando mejor su taller, con el crédito Luis va a comprar madera y alguna herramienta da trabajo para incrementar su productividad, Luis aspira mejorar su negocio y terminar de pagar de su casa que es donde funciona su taller.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife. He says that when he was young he worked for 8 years as a carpentry worker and after that he decided to buy tools to set up his own business, but he is continually improving his workshop.

With the loan Luis plans to buy wood and some work tools to increase his productivity. He hopes to improve his business and finish off paying for his house, which is where he operates his workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Rhubemuguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maneno est une femme ambitieuse et dirigeante du groupe Rhubemuguma.  Agée de 40ans, elle est mariée à un Pasteur  et mère de 7 enfants (6 scolarisés). Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt  pour acheter 4 sacs d’arachide et 1 tonne de manioc.  Son objectif  est de garantir le bien être de sa famille et acheter un véhicule pour le transport de ses marchandises. Enfin, elle remercie beaucoup Hekima.
texts.en: This client, Maneno, is an ambitious woman and the manager of the group Rhubemuguma. She is 40 years old, married to a pastor, and the mother of seven children (six in school). She is requesting this new loan to purchase four sacks of peanuts and a tonne of cassava. Her goal is to guarantee her family’s wellbeing and to purchase a vehicle for transporting her merchandise. Lastly, she thanks Hekima very much.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of peanuts and a tonne of cassava

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, necesita abastecer con más mercadería su negocio para atraer a nuevos clientes y seguir mejorando sus ingresos, por lo que opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, dulces, pan, galletas, arroz, frijoles, jabón, aceite, pastas dentales, condimentos, entre otros productos.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior surtió su negocio, ha mantenido sus ingresos estables, su familia se encuentra saludable y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
Reina needs to stock her business with more goods to attract new customers and continue to improve her income, so she has decided on a new loan to buy fizzy drinks, juices, snacks, sweets, bread, rice, beans, soap, oil, toothpaste, condiments and other items.

With the help of the previous loan she stocked her business and has maintained a steady income. Her family is in good health and she has paid off her loan.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, juices, snacks, sweets, bread, rice, beans, soap, oil, toothpaste, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a 21-year-old young woman living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school teaching sessions on life and study skills on a weekly basis. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to produce about 120 broiler birds every six weeks. 

Memory would very much like to increase her sales volume and her income. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks, and the feed and supplies needed to raise them. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks, and the feed and supplies needed to raise them.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 37-year-old married mother of four children. She lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering her time on a weekly basis to teach life skills classes at her local secondary school. To earn a living, she runs a poultry operation that produces about 150 broiler birds every six weeks. She sells the birds to local residents, helping to feed her community. 

Theresa would like to increase her sales volume to elevate her family’s standard of living and become more financially stable. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Eliana, sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ceviche, la socia continua vendiendo de forma ambulatoria la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, la socia continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Imasumac II”,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como pescado, limón entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member, Eliana, remains committed to the business of selling ceviche.  She continues to operate a mobile stall. She wants to continue working in this way to continue to support her family.

She continues to belong to the communal bank "Imasumac II".  The member is a responsible and an earnest person.  In this manner, the member supports her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as fish, lemon and other items.  The member is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fish, lemons and other items.

loans.name: Jose Santana

texts.es:
José, es parte de una familia integrada por su esposa y un hijo de 17 años de edad, quien está estudiando segundo año bachillerato; José se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace 40 años, trabaja solo, su hijo lo ayuda en su tiempo libre, su horario es de ocho de la mañana  a cinco de la tarde, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, su ventaja es que es propietario del terreno en el que realiza sus cultivos.
Solicita capital para comprar herbicidas, insecticidas, abono, semilla y plaguicidas, con lo que espera tener una buena cosecha, abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes, tener ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Su anhelo es continuar trabajando en el campo para brindar a su familia una buena alimentación, vestuario, alimentación y dar a su hijo una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
José's family consists of himself, his wife and a 17-year-old son, who is in the second year of the high school diploma. For 40 years José has made a living growing corn and beans. He works alone and his son helps him in his free time. He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. He learnt the skills from his father and he has the advantage of owning the land where he grows his crops.

José is asking for a loan to buy weedkiller, insecticides, manure, seed and pesticides, with which he hopes to get a good harvest, supply his family and his customers and have enough income to cover his family's basic needs.

He hopes to continue working the land to provide his family with a good diet, clothing, and to give his son a quality education.

loans.use: to buy weedkiller, insecticides, manure, seed and pesticides.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en: Nyasha is a 22-year-old resident of the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide at a local school. When she is not volunteering in her community, Nyasha keeps herself busy with her thriving poultry business. She loves her business and is excited to see it grow. Nyasha is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase chick feed, chemicals, and more chicks to generate higher profits. This will help raise her standard of living and allow her to better provide for her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase chick feed, chemicals, and more chicks to generate higher profits.

loans.name: Pembelani

texts.en:
Pembelani is a 29-year-old married mother of three living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Learner Guide, teaching a weekly life-skills session at her local secondary school. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to produce about 40 broilers birds every six weeks and sells them to area residents. 

Pembelani would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to supermarkets. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost sales. She hopes to provide for her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 22-year-old businesswoman living in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. Lorna volunteers with the elderly members of her community and the local schoolchildren as a Camfed Learner Guide. She devotes the rest of her time to her business. She buys and sells clothing to financially support her family. Lorna seeks a Kiva loan because she would love to expand her business by increasing her stock. She is also interested in the opportunity to create jobs for other people in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia María sigue dedicándose a la venta de joyas ,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, la socia continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Imasumac II”,la socia vende lo que son aretes,collares,pulseras entre otros para todo sus clientes que le solicitan siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aretes entre otros.
María se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
María is still selling jewellery. She has been doing this for several years and she is doing well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to continue working so that she can continue to support her family in this way.

María belongs to the "Imasumac II" communal bank. She sells earrings, necklaces, bracelets and other items to all her customers who want them, and this is how she brings up her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy earrings among other things. María is grateful for the loan and promises to be very responsible about paying her agreed loan instalments.

loans.use: to buy earrings among other items.

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is 26 years old and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe with her husband. Rumbidzai has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education at her local secondary school every week. In addition, Rumbidzai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  
With a Kiva loan, Rumbidzai will purchase more stock to increase her supplies and increase her profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to help her family with their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Sidilia

texts.en: Sidilia is a 19-year-old mother from the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a weekly Camfed Learner Guide volunteer, teaching life-skills education to young students. Additionally, Sidilia runs a small business at the community flea market. She focuses on selling various items of clothing and accessories in order to support her family. Sidilia's business has been up and running for six months. She has high hopes for her business. With the Kiva loan, she will purchase items in bulk to reduce costs and increase profits. Then, she intends to open her own store. A larger, more stable business will enable Sidilia to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en: Tariro is a 29-year-old mother from the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, she helps young students develop life skills. As a businesswoman, Tariro sells chickens to the community. Over the past year she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks. Tariro started the business because she wanted to be financially independent. Tariro would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. Tariro hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent. She also desires to advance her education.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Laiza

texts.en:
Laiza is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married with two children and is living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. 

She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school, teaching a weekly life skills class. She has also grown her poultry business to its current capacity, producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents.

Laiza would very much like to increase her sales volume to improve her income and her family’s quality of life. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 23-year-old married mother of one from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school and as a community health trainer. Brenda works at the local business centre, as well. She sells shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets but she would really like to expand her business. 

Brenda will use the requested Kiva loan to purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets to increase her stock. Brenda intends to use the proceeds to improve her standard of living and also create job opportunities for other members of her community.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets to increase her stock.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and is living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school teaching life skills sessions on a weekly basis. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013.  

Melody would like to increase her sales volume to increase her income. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her family and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Magret is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has two children, living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school teaching a weekly life skills group. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2009 to support her family.  
Magret would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to supermarkets. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items of clothing in bulk for her stall.

loans.name: Lindiwe

texts.en:
Lindiwe is 22 years old. She is married with one child and lives in Zimbabwe’s Chiredzi District. Lindiwe has been volunteering weekly as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education at her local school. To earn a living, Lindiwe operates a small grocery store where she sells basic essentials such as toiletries, flour, salt, milk, and cooking oil. 
With a Kiva loan, Lindiwe will purchase inventory and expand her selection of items to boost her business.  A higher income will help her increase her family’s standard of living and improve their stability.

loans.use: To puchase more stock such as toiletries, flour, salt, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and pans.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is 26 years old and married with three children. She resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe, where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide; Mavis teaches new ways of learning to the children of the local school. 

In addition to her volunteer work, Mavis has a small business at the local flea market. She rents a table to sell products such as dresses, hats, socks, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. Mavis has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family. Her husband also helps her with running the business. With a Kiva loan, Mavis will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies and improve her profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrise is a 21-year-old resident of the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Beatrise teaches life skills education as a Camfed Learner Guide, but she is also committed to her business. When Beatrise is not volunteering, she rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. With a Kiva loan, Beatrise will purchase more inventory in bulk to reduce her costs and increase her profits. She intends to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. Beatrise also wants to continue her education and train to become a teacher.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Getrude is a 20 year business women, she is married with one child and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully doing buying and selling of clothes over the years. She has been trained as a Learner Guide with Camfed Zimbabwe. With the requested loan she intends to have bulk purchases of clothes and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes

loans.name: Fortunate

texts.en: Fortunate is 27-years-old and married with two children. She resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Fortunate is both a volunteer and a businesswoman. She is a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education at a local school and also works at a grocery shop. Fortunate rents a store and sells products such as sugar, flour, rice, salt, cooking oil, and drinks. She has been running this business for the past year and it has enabled her to support her family. Fortunate intends to increase her inventory with the help of a Kiva loan. She specifically would like to purchase bread, biscuits, and soap to sell to members of her community. Fortunate intends to grow her business and open her own store one day.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Portia

texts.en: Portia is a 27-year-old resident of the Guruve District of Zimbabwe.  As a Camfed Learner Guide, she volunteers at a local by offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. Over the past year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every 6 weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business to alleviate her family's financial stresses. Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Portia would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Portia will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to increase profits and, in turn, better support her family.

loans.use: To to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 27 years old and lives with his wife. He works in gas distribution and has a portfolio of clients and earns a commission. The business was started by his father, who owns three pipes and Fernando is in charge of one of them. 

Fernando is asking for a loan to do some maintenance on his truck. He says that his goal is to get more clients and acquire more gas trucks like his father.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his gas truck.

loans.name: Blessed

texts.en: Blessed is 19-years-old and resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Blessed volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide; she helps young students develop life skills. To support her family, Blessed rents a table at the local hair salon. She focuses on selling braids, weaves, and hair treatments. With a Kiva loan, Blessed will be able to purchase more supplies to serve her customers. This will help boost her business and increase her income. Blessed will then be able to better support her family, as well as become more financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Manyara

texts.en:
Manyara is a 27 year-old young woman. She is married and has one child and is currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school teaching life skills sessions every week. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in 2012 because she wanted to be financially independent.  
Manyara would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 19-year-old young woman currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school teaching life skills sessions. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broilers birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 
A Kiva loan will allow Shamiso to invest in more broiler chicks and the feed and supplies she needs to raise them. This increased production will help raise her income to a level that will help her become financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 28 years old. She is married and resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Gloria has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, voluntarily teaching life skills education at her local secondary school on a weekly basis. In addition, Gloria rents a table at the local flea market where she sells men’s and women’s clothing and accessories. 
With a Kiva loan, Gloria will purchase clothing in bulk to reduce her unit costs and increase profit margins. Her desire is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pretty

texts.en: Pretty is a 24-year-old woman living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she helps young students develop life skills. When she is not volunteering, Pretty runs a poultry operation at her homestead. She raises broiler chicks to six weeks and then sells them to members of her community. Pretty plans to use a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks, as well as the feed and supplies she needs to raise them. This will help her increase her overall production and boost her income. Pretty intends to improve her standard of living and become more financially independent

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Kesani

texts.en: Kesani is a 33-year-old married businesswoman from the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She mentors students at the local school as a Camfed Learner Guide. When Kesani is not volunteering, she sells mobile phone cards in her community. Kesani intends to use the Kiva loan to purchase more phone cards for resale. By boosting her volume, she can increase her income and better provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 23-year-old young woman. She is married and is currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering every week at her local secondary school teaching a life skills class. To earn a living, she sells furniture and appliances from South Africa, such as wardrobes, sofas, stoves, and refrigerators. 
Caroline would very much like to increase her sales and offer a wider variety of items. She will use a Kiva loan to purchase items to resell. She hopes to provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as wardrobes, sofas, stoves, and refrigerators.

loans.name: Nyengeterai

texts.en:
Nyengeterai is a 28-year-old married businesswoman from the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at a local school in her community, teaching life and study skills to students. 

Nyengeterai also has been operating a small grocery shop for several years, and she has seen it grow over time. Nyengeterai's goals are to increase her sales volume and expand her inventory. She would use the Kiva loan to purchase more goods in bulk to reduce her costs and boost her profits. A higher income will help her provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 25-year-old Camfed Learner Guide in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Faith's volunteer work includes teaching life skills education in the local school as a Camfed Learner Guide. When she is not volunteering, Faith runs a small business. Faith sells dresses, shirts, skirts, and track suits at the local flea market. Faith is asking for a Kiva loan so that she will be able to increase her amount of supplies and also buy different items to sell. Faith would like to grow the business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is a 20-year-old businesswoman, wife, and mother from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. Ellen has been successfully buying and selling clothes for the past year; she sells jackets, shirts, skirts, lingerie, and underwear. When she is not working in her flea market, Joyce serves as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. With the Kiva loan, Ellen intends to make bulk clothing purchases to reduce costs and boost her profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To make bulk clothing purchases to reduce costs and boost her profits.

loans.name: Onai

texts.en:
Onai is 27 years old; she is married and has two children. She resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe.She has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education at her local secondary school on a weekly basis. In addition, Onai rents a small grocery shop at the local town center where she sells products such as sugar, rice, flour, salt, milk, and cooking oil. She has been running this business for three years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  
With a Kiva loan, Onai will purchase her inventory in bulk to reduce costs and increase her profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as sugar, rice, flour, salt, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 46 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. She is separated with 2 children. 
Amelita has a shop that sells dried fish and longganisa. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. Amelita works hard to afford the tuition fees of her daughter who is about to graduate next year.
Amelita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Amelita hopes to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is married with 1 child. She is 28 years old and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian City,Philippines.

     Joan runs a sari-sari (general) store to earn a living and has had this business for 8 months. Each month she earns PHP 3,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

     Joan has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hope to become successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 50 years old and lives in Tangub City. She is married with six children. 
Irenea has a shop that sells vegetables. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional vegetables for her business. 
Irenea has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Irenea hopes to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resalel

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 26 years and is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels good about applying for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $ 800.00. She will buy some additional supplies for her store such as  body lotion, biscuits, bread, oil, milk, noodles, shampoo, sugar, salt and slippers. She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, biscuits, bread, oil, milk, noodles, shampoo, sugar, salt and slippers

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: To make a living, Anecita has been operating a retail store for more than eleven years and she earns well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.  Anecita always find ways in order to augment their living. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ivan Francisco

texts.en:
Ivan Francisco is a Kubo.financiero client and this is his story.

Ivan Francisco is 23 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in his parents' house. He has a handcraft workshop. He is asking for a loan to buy materials to produce handcrafts. 

Ivan Francisco mostly makes religious pieces, which he sells at both wholesale and retail. His best season is November and December, but he needs to start producing the pieces now.

Ivan Francisco says that he is continuing a family tradition; his father taught him to make handcrafts and now he has his own workshop. His goal is to make it grow and provide financial stability to his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for production of handcrafts.

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en:
Renerio is 65 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 6 children.
Renerio has a tailoring business and earns approximately 10000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for additional capital, buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

Renerio has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Renerio hopes to expand his shop.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 55 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.
To earn a living, Elisa has a business selling banana cue for snacks. She earns about 5000 each month doing this type of business. Elisa has requested a loan for additional capital. She wants to purchase bananas for her snack vending business.
Elisa has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Elisa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for her snack vending business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela  is 55 years old with six children.  Marcela personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chance of a low or zero catch.   Marcela has comfortable home in Silanga, Tangub City.

loans.use: purchase new nets

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with four children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
A $ 600.00 loan is offered to Lucia to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as candles,noodles, cigarettes and slippers. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Lucia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy candles, noodles, cigarettes and slippers

loans.name: Senthamarai Shg-Angiyanur Group

texts.en:
Chitra is married and the leader of the Senthamarai Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation in Tamil Nadu.

Chitra lives in her own house with her family. Her husband Kalivanan works in a cement factory. They live in Angiyanur, a small village in the Ariyalur district. Chitra has taken loans from PAT previously and has repaid the loans on time.

Chitra and the other members of the group need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than a traditional stove. The smokeless stove produces less carbon dioxide and maintains a healthy environment. They are convenient for cooking and designed for daily use.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Panneerpushpam Shg-Malathangulam Group

texts.en:
Panneerpushpam Self Help Group is managed by the NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. This group consists of five members from Malathangulam village, Ariyalur district.

Arockiyamary is the leader of group. She lives with her family in her own house. She has two sons who are studying in the 8th and 6th standard. Her husband is a farmer by profession.

Arockiyamary, along with other group members, needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove. It is durable, handy, easy to use, sustainable, and it emits less smoke, which reduces the risk of respiratory diseases. The traditional mud stove emits more carbon dioxide and due to this, children are affected the most leading to asthma, bronchitis etc.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Luz Gladis

texts.es:
Luz es una feliz habitante del barrio Aranjuez del municipio de Medellín, desde allí se ha desempaño hace 15 años al negocio de la venta de abarrotes en una tienda ubicada en esa propia casa.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora y todos los días atiende su negocio desde la 8.00 am hasta las 9:00 pm.
Sus hijos le ayudan en ocasiones en las tardes, esto hace que su trabajo no se vuelca tan pesado y pueda mantener esa buena disposición que la caracteriza.
Ella solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido como frituras y licores, productos que complementaran muy bien su amplia oferta de abarrotes.
Su sueño es poder continuar con su negocio y sacarlo adelante exitosamente.
texts.en:
Luz is a happy inhabitant of the Aranjuez barrio in Medellín. There for 15 years she has had a business selling groceries in a store in her own house.

Luz is a very hard-working woman and every day she works at her business from 8am until 9pm. 

Luz's children sometimes help her in the afternoons, meaning that the work does not become too arduous and Luz can keep up the good mood that she is known for.

Luz is applying for financial support in order to buy stock such as fried snacks and liquors. These products will compliment her ample offer of groceries already available.

Luz's dream is to continue with her business and move forward with it successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock such as fried snacks and liquors.

loans.name: Jaime Arcenio

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 29 años de edad vive en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos  su estado civil casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 8, 7 y 3 años
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PAULINA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto LA PAULINA perteneciente al canton Pueblo Viejo  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, también a la crianza de pollo de canchón utilizara el dinero del crédito para la siembra de ciclo corto en los insumos agricolas y realizara las compras en Ventanas.
Su sueño es comprarse una maquina agricola, en su tiempo libre se dedica al deporte.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years old and lives in the Ventanas canton of Los Ríos province. Jaime is married and lives with his wife and children, who are aged eight, seven and three years old respectively.

Jaime is a member of the "La Paulina" communal bank, located in the Puerto Pechiche parish of the La Paulina rural settlement. La Paulina is part of the Pueblo Viejo canton and here the people make a living in farming.

Jaime himself works in farming: he grows corn and raising chickens. This loan will be used to buy farming supplies for sowing crops; Jaime will buy his supplies in Ventanas.

Jaime's dream is to buy farming equipment. In his spare time Jaime plays sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Normal José

texts.es:
El señor Norbal José es un joven obrero que vive en el departamento de Madriz, Nicaragua, en una comarca llamada ducuali a uno 25 km al sur de la cabecera departamental, está felizmente casado y tiene 1 hijo, él tiene más de 23 años de residir en esa dirección siendo una persona muy conocida por los vecinos.
este cliente es un obrero que labora en una fábrica que procesa el tabaco para la elaboración de puros de exportación, él tiene aproximadamente más de 5 años de laborar para empresa, cabe mencionar que su esposa también labora como obrero para la empresa, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso para el sostén de su núcleo familiar.
Este cliente se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel para hacer formal solicitud de un financiamiento para poder comprar láminas de zinc y mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que por cuenta propia él no tiene la capacidad económica para poder realizar esta inversión por lo que acude a solicitar este crédito, este es su segundo crédito que él solicita.
Él se muestra positivo y espera que el crédito le sea otorgado y poder seguir mejorando su vivienda y así poder darle una vivienda más diga a su familia.
texts.en:
Norbal Jose is a young worker who lives in the department of Madriz, Nicaragua, in a county called Ducuali which is 25 kilometers south of the department seat.  He is happily married and has a son.  For over 23 years he has resided where he lives and is very well known by his neighbors.

This customer works in a tobacco factory that makes cigars for export.  He has been working there for over five years.  His wife also works at the company so this is their source of income for the household.

This client came to the Ceprodel offices to make a formal request for a loan to buy metal sheeting to repair the roof of his house.  He does not have the economic capacity to make the investment on his own so that is why he is requesting this second loan.

He is positive and hopeful the loan will be granted so he can make improvements at home and give his family a more dignified living environment.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting.

loans.name: Morena Marisol

texts.es:
Morena, utilizo el capital que se le otorgo anteriormente en surtir la venta de mariscos, logrando surtir a sus clientes y a los comedores en los que entrega un pedido más grande, tiene mejores ingresos, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo y ha cancelado su deuda.
Está solicitando capital para comprar pescado, camarones, conchas  entre otros mariscos, para mantener la continuidad de su negocio y seguir generando ingresos necesarios para subsistir.
texts.en:
Morena used her previous loan to stock up her business with seafood. This provided enough to supply customers and restaurants that make larger orders. Morena now has higher earnings. Morena's family is the same as before, and Morena has paid off her debt.

Morena is applying for this loan in order to buy fish. shrimp, shellfish and other seafood in order to continue with her business and to generate an income to pay for necessities.

loans.use: to buy fish. shrimp, shellfish and other seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, bags, fizzy drinks, juices and water.

loans.name: Walter Osmin

texts.es:
Walter, recolecto en menor tiempo su cosecha, con la buena inversión del crédito anterior, pudo distribuir sus granos y mejoro su situación económica, brinda a su familia mejores circunstancias de vida.
Se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar concentrado, pollos de engorde, abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla, fortalecerá la granja de aves de corral y seguirá invirtiendo en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Walter was able to speed up his crop production time thanks to the previous loan.  He was able to distribute the grain and improve his economic situation, giving his family better living conditions.

He has decided to request a new loan to buy animal feed, chickens, compost, insectides, pesticides and seeds.   He will strengthen the barnyard fowl business and continue investing in agriculture.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, chickens, compost, insecticides, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Salaikaraiamman Shg-Veerasinganpetti Group

texts.en:
30-year-old married Seethalakshmi is the leader of the Salaikaraiamman Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People Action for the Transformation in Tamil Nadu. She lives in the small village of Veerasinganpetti in her house with her family.

Seethalakshmi's husband, Pannerselvam, is a driver. They have two children. Seethalakshmi has taken loans from the PAT previously and repaid the loans on time.

Seethalakshmi and the other members of the group want to buy a smokeless stove that emits less smoke. The smoke from traditional stoves irritates the eyes and lungs and makes them susceptible to respiratory diseases. The smokeless stove reduces the risk of respiratory diseases and helps them lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат родилась в 1976 году. Она мать 3 детей. Ее муж повар. Саломат окончила педагогический университет и уже более 10 лет работает в средней школе учительницей таджикского языка и литературы. Она является одной из успешных учителей. Саломат данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как ее дочь больна уже в течение нескольких лет, и она должна лечить ее. Саломат запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Salomat was born in 1976. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a cook. Salomat graduated from a pedagogical university and has been working at a secondary school as a Tajik language and literature teacher for over 10 years. She is one of the most successful teachers. At the present time, Salomat needs financial assistance because her daughter has been sick for several years and has to seek treatment. Salomat is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase medicine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her daughter's treatment

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 43 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, beers, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, beers, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 31 years old and is married with two children. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Liza has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

Liza is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 59 years old, and is married with twelve children, two of whom are in school.

Diosa and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Diosa has been with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through her agriculture business.

With your help, Diosa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dotela

texts.en:
Dotela is 50 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is in school. Dotela works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dotela has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

Dotela is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old, and is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her beauty parlor business and is committed to regain what she lost. Milagros is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Milagros has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Tani Sari Group

texts.en:
The Tani Sari group is located in Berawantangi village, Jembrana, West Bali. Most of the inhabitants work as farmers and pig breeders. 

They are facing the dry season, which requires them to find different types of plants suitable for the dry season, in order to increase their income. The group have selected to plant beans and other types of crops. They need additional funds to purchase seeds and fertilizer. 

Ten of the women who have similar businesses joined together in a group and applied to MUK for a loan. In addition to getting venture capital loans, they also received training from MUK.

The Tani Sari group are pictured, with the leader, Sayu Putu. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. With this loan she hopes can cultivate the land properly in order to produce the maximum and the family's economy.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulbuta

texts.ru: Гулбута живет в Таджикистане среди гор и холмов, где природа подарила людям возможность для развития сельского хозяйства. Она 7 лет назад начала свой бизнес, не так как другие жители ее района земледелием и скотоводством, а купле продажей хозяйственных товаров. Так как она живет в сельской местности и там мало конкуренции, так и ей легко справляться с бизнесом. Она покупает товар оптом из городского рынка и реализует в розницу на своей лавке. Она общительная и милая женщина и поэтому умеет делать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. Для этого ей необходимо увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США  для покупки хозяйственных товаров как чайник, кастрюля, тарелки и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbuta lives in Tajikistan among mountains and hills, where the weather gifted people with an opportunity to develop agricultural businesses. She started her business 7 years ago, but not in farming or animal husbandry like other residents of her district, but in selling household goods. Because she lives in rural area, where there is little competition, it is easy for her to handle her business. She buys merchandise wholesale at a city market and sells it retail at her store. Gulbuta is a personable and cute woman, who can have an individual approach to every client. She wants to expand her business and earn more income. For this, she needs to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to buy household goods, such as teapots, stockpots, dishes, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: o buy household goods, such as teapots, stockpots, dishes, etc. in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Due to insufficient income, Jessie has a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is 59 years old and has five children. He is raising his family in a rural community and makes their living through farming. 

Jessie aimed to improve their status of living to sustain the necessities of his family and give them a better life. He planned to improve his hog raising business but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs, and additional piglets to raise. 

He hopes that someday, he will increase his income and improve their status of living through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her agriculture business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help, Virginia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now. 

Ceferina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Yeang is 35 years old and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2003 and has two children - one son and one daughter.
  
Yeang is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a construction worker. She wants to buy rice from the rice farmer in her village for food, so she decided to apply for a loan. Buying rice from the villager is cheaper than at the market so Yeang can save some money.

loans.use: to buy rice for food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and gravel, and to pay labourers to finish building a room in her home.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat is single and lives with his aunt in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Nat is a motorcycle repairman. He wants to buy more motorcycle spare parts so that he can better respond to his customer’s needs, and has requested a loan for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Luren

texts.en:
Luren is 34 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. Luren works very hard to provide for them.

Luren's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Luren has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

Luren is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and is married with five children. Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Delia has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Urelyn

texts.en:
Urelyn is 56 years old and is married with seven children. Urelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Urelyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her agriculture busines and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

Urelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a business selling Avon products in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 14 years. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 65 years old and married with three children. Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc. 

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support Golap. She is the president of “Maa Tarini SHG" self-help group, and is pictured here as the lady standing with her hand raised. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or they own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India. With her portion of the loan, Golap will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. 

After this loan, Golap will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Golap is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm. All the members of this group belong to the same community. The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickled vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 56 years old and has two children. Eufemia is married and has two children who are in school.

Eufemia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eufemia has been in pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Luon (in photo) is aged 52 and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has three children: one son and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives in a separate home, and two are garment factory workers.
 
Luon is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a rice farmer. Her husband always spends a lot of money for plowing fees because he does not have his own cows. Hence, Luon decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for her husband.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s rice farming business by buying two cows for plowing rice farmland

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre trabajador, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Camaná junto a su familia.
Desde hace  varios años trabaja como agente de seguridad en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien puesto que es una persona muy responsable, trabajador, emprendedor y con muchos deseos de superación.
Jairo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el mantenimiento a su motocicleta de esta manera no tendrá inconvenientes para transportarse a su trabajo. Con esto seguirá esforzándose en su trabajo para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Jairo is a hardworking man.  He is 35 years old.  He is single and lives in Camaná with his family.  For many years he has worked as a security guard in a prestigious company, and it is going well because he is very responsible, hardworking,  and entrepreneurial, with a desire for self improvement.  Jairo is thankful to the Kiva lenders because their support has allowed him to repair his motorcycle so that he is able to get to work.  This will allow him to continue to work hard at his job to improve his family's quality of live and provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Grethel Alejandra

texts.es:
Nicaragua es conocida por sus lagos, sus majestuosos volcanes y la increíble diversidad de fauna. Grethel, es una joven de 18 años, quien, como muchos nicaragüenses siempre ha admirado esta cualidad del país.
