Para ella es muy importante que los ciudadanos sigan preservando el medio ambiente, por esta razón ha decidido comenzar a estudiar Derecho desde hace 2 años en la Universidad Centroamericana.
Esta defensora de los derechos medio ambientales, quiere seguir escalando con su sueño de concluir su carrera universitaria, por esta razón, necesita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y no tener ninguna barrera enfrente de sus metas, como alumna ejemplar. Esta herramienta le permitirá realizar sus investigaciones en pro de sus estudios. Entre sus metas principales está obtener una especialización en derecho ambiental y derecho constitucional. Ayúdanos a que esta soñadora cumpla con este gran impacto social.
texts.en: Nicaragua is know for its lakes, its majestic volcanoes and the incredible diversity of its wildlife.  Grethel is an 18 year old woman who, like many Nicaraguans, admires these qualities of her country.  It is very important to her that the citizens continue to preserve the environment, which is why she decided to start studying law 2 years ago at the Universidad Centroamericana.  This defender of environmental laws wants to continue to pursue her dream of completing her university degree.  For this reason, she needs a loan to purchase a computer so that she does not have any barriers to achieving her goals, as she is an exemplary student. This tool will allow her to do research in support of her studies.  Among her main goals are to obtain a specialization in environmental law and constitutional law.  Help us so this dreamer can have a great social impact.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Guadiosa

texts.en:
Guadiosa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Guadiosa is 43 years old and her three children are in school.

Guadiosa has a business direct selling Avon and Personal Collection products in the Philippines. Guadiosa requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more Avon and Personal Collection products to sell.

Guadiosa has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Guadiosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon and Personal Collection products to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Guadalupe expresa con entusiasmo y agradecimiento el crecimiento que ha logrado tener gracias al primer préstamo de KIVA, pues con ello pudo comprar más productos de gran demanda como el arroz y los frijoles para su pulpería. De igual forma no le faltaron las frutas para la venta de sus refrescos. Ahora, su negocio ya tiene tres años de los cuales se siente orgullosa y más aun que cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana. 
Desde que salió de la secundaria, se ha centrado en trabajar, pues sus deseos de superación siempre han estado presentes. Ya cumplida su primera meta, ahora quiere seguir con la siguiente, pues quiere agregar un nuevo producto en venta, que son las sandalias. Por esta razón, necesita de un préstamo nuevo para poder comprar las sandalias al por mayor, además de seguir comprando granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, huevos, entre otros, que le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su siguiente meta es seguir trabajando duro, pues desea seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Guadalupe is enthusiastic and thankful for the growth she has achieved thanks to her first loan with Kiva.  With the loan, she was able to purchase more high demand products such as rice and beans for her shop.  She also had plenty of fruit to sell fruit juices.  She is proud of the 3 years that her shop has been in business, and that she has the support of her sister. Ever since she completed secondary school she has focused on working as she has always wanted to improve her situation.  She has achieved her first goal and now wants to continue with her next one, which is to add sandals to her range of products for sale.  For this reason she is requesting a new loan to purchase sandals wholesale, in addition to continuing to purchase staple grains such as rice, beans, eggs, etc. that will allow her to provide better service to her customers.  Her next goal is to continue to work hard because she wants to continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 44 years old and chose to be single. He lives in a rural community with some of his cousins. He cultivates his farm land by planting rice and some vegetables to sell. He has been a farmer for almost fifteen years now.

He aimed to expand his plantation and increase his production, but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice. Through this financial assistance, he believes that he will expand his plantation and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 50-year-old married woman and has five grown-up children.

She is a vendor selling vegetables to the people in her village. She offers her merchandise on a house-to-house basis, particularly in the morning. She gains income and revolves it into the business, while part of it goes for meals and bills at home. Nenita also helps support her grandchild when she has extra money.

Nenita is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy eggplants, beans, tomatoes and bananas to sell. Most of her customers are her friends and she always extends friendly services to them, which gives her good sales and profits in return.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, beans, tomatoes and bananas to sell

loans.name: Primer

texts.en:
Primer is 31 years old, married and has three children. Two of them are studying.

Primer sustains her children's daily allowances through her income from a retail business. She manages a small store while her spouse is a farmer. Together, they generate an income for living.

Now, Primer wanted to increase her income but had insufficient funds to buy more merchandise to sell. She is now asking for a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar to sell. This will help her acquire more sales and income. Someday she hopes to continue generating good profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Sara Del Carmen

texts.es: Sara de 24 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que se gana la vida por medio de la venta de productos por catálogos los cuales distribuye en los cantones cercanos a su vivienda desde hace seis años. Esa experiencia le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Sara desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado y esto hace que sus pertenencias y su familia se encuentren inseguros por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lamina galvanizada, clavos y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda y darle una mayor protección a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sara is a 24-year-old single mother who lives with her 6-year-old son. She is a very enterprising woman who earns a living selling products from catalogs which she has distributed in the surrounding areas to where she lives for six years. This experience has helped her to increase her sales and therefore improve her economic income. Sara wishes to change the roof of her home as it is deteriorated and so her belongings and her family are unsafe.

She is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails and wood to repair the roof of her home and give her greater protection in her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails and wood to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena como madre emprendedora decidió montar su negocio de venta de calzado con el ánimo de aportar recursos para su hogar pues siempre se preocupaba por que su hijo tuviera una sana alimentación una buen educación y una cada donde dormir por ello inicio con su negocio de venta de calzado.
Siempre ha querido expandirse y abarcar más publico pues esto el generaría más ventas por ello quiere agregar a sus servicios una línea de ropa para hombre y dama por ello solicita un crédito para surtirse de ropa e iniciar lo más pronto sus ventas. 
Su principal sueño es tener un local comercial puesto que es una vendedora puerta a puerta generar buenas ganancias y vivir más cómoda y placenteramente con su hijo
texts.en:
As an enterprising mother, Lorena decided to launch her shoe sales business with the intention of providing resources for her home. She always worried about her son having healthy food, a good education and a place to sleep, and for this reason she started her shoe sales business.

She has always wanted to expand and reach more customers as this would generate more sales. For this reason she wants to add a men's and women's clothing line to her services, and she is applying for a loan to stock up on clothes and start her sales as soon as possible.
 
Her biggest dreams are to have a fixed sales premises as she is a door-to-door saleswoman, to generate good income and to live more comfortably and happily with her son.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing in order to expand what she offers to her clients.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Merly works very hard to provide for them.

Merly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Merly has been in her business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. With two children in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Myrna has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Myrna has taken a 9,714 Philippine peso (PHP) housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Myrna is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Loeng's Group

texts.en:
Loeng was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho. In the group, there are two members, Loeng and Kakada, who live in suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Loeng, aged 55, is a widowed mother with two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and another one is a garment factory worker. 

Loeng carries soft drink and coffee by hand cart to sell in Phnom Penh. She wants to expand her business by buying more soft drink for resale. Hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to help her capital. 

Loeng is on the right and Kakada is on the left.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more soft drink for resale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 52 years old, married, and has four children. Juanita works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks like cereals, coffee, sugar, deodorant, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, sugar, deodorant, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like cereals, coffee, sugar, deodorant, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат молодая жизнерадостная и общительная женщина. Ей 37 лет. Замужем. Мать двоих прекрасных детишек. У Мархамат очень дружная семья. Муж Мархамат Шухрат на сегодняшний день пенсионер, раньше он работал в милиции. Дополнительно Шухрат иногда на своей машине таксует, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Сама Мархамат очень трудолюбивый человек. С молодости она трудилась, самостоятельно зарабатывала деньги, таким образом, она вкладывала свою часть доли в семейный бюджет. Поначалу Мархамат занималась продажей мелкоштучных продуктов питания, со временем она расширила свой ассортимент и возле маххалинской чайханы открыла себе не большой магазинчик продуктов питания. С тех пор Мархамат занималась торговлей, даже после замужества она продолжила свой маленький бизнес. А на сегодняшний день Мархамат имеет свой бутик на центральном рынке района. Она торгует женскими одеждами. У нее много клиентов, все ее клиенты довольны ею ведь она очень общительная и приветлива, встречает своих клиентов, что не мало важно для торговли. Мархамат в летний сезон хотела бы умножить ассортимент женских одежд и на этом немножко подзаработать денег. Но ей для покупки и привозки вещей не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому она подала заявку на кредит. Мархамат выражает свои благодарности МДО Арванд за поддержку и за оперативную работу сотрудников организации.
texts.en:
Marhamat is a young, cheerful, and sociable woman. She is 37 years old and is married. She is the mother of two beautiful children. Marhamat’s family is very friendly. Marhamat’s husband, Shukhrat, is a retired police officer and receives a pension. Additionally, Shukhrat sometimes drives his car as a taxi to support his family.

Marhamat is a very hardworking person. Since her youth, she has worked hard to earn money in order to contribute her share to the family’s budget. Originally, Marhamat sold small-sized food, but over time, she has expanded the scope of her business and opened a small food shop near the teahouse. Marhamat continued operating her small business after getting married. Today, Marhamat also has a stall in the central market that sells women's clothing.  She has many customers, all of whom are happy with her because she is a very sociable, friendly and welcoming, which is important for business.

In the summer season, Marhamat would like to increase her inventory of women's clothes and earn a little bit more income. However, she doesn’t have enough money to purchase and deliver the inventory and has applied for a loan. Marhamat is grateful for the support and operational work of the MDO Arvand organization.

loans.use: buy women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет и работает в Виноградово, продает детские костюмчики на рынке. Начинать торговлю в этой сфере было нелегко, но родные помогли стартовать. 
Наталья собирается использовать сумму в 40 000 гривен для того, чтобы докупить больше товара: одежду, обувь, головные уборы, чтобы снова разнообразить товар и развивать бизнес. Наталья мечтает однажды открыть свой собственный магазин. Наталья — очень уверена в своих действиях, и также целеустремленна, что помогло ей добиться успехов в работе и торговле.
texts.en: Natalya lives and works in Vinogradovo, where she sells children's clothes in the market. It was not easy to launch this business, but her family helped her get started. Natalya is going to use the amount of 40,000 UAH to buy more more goods such as clothing, footwear and hats in order to diversify her product line and grow her business. Natalya dreams of one day opening her own store.  Natalya is very confident and purposeful in her actions, which helped her achieve success in her business.

loans.use: to diversify her product line by purchasing clothing, footwear and hat merchandise for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has been selling lampakanay (Typha orientalis) products for many years and was successful in improving them. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for the business and was able to buy a motorcycle to use for transporting its products. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase more lampakanay string and to fully pay for his motorcycle.

In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business as well as the general living situation of his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more lampakanay string and to fully pay for his motorcycle

loans.name: Andrey

texts.ru:
Андрей занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в с. Водяное уже 5 лет. У него 9 больших отапливаемых теплиц, в которых он выращивает помидоры и огурцы. Андрей учился в Запорожском национальном техническом университете, получил специальность инженер-механик. По специальности работал 2 года, потом решил заниматься только сельским хозяйством. Он живет с женой, двумя сыновьями и мамой. 
На 40 000 гривен Андрей планирует купить земельный участок, чтобы дальше расширять бизнес и строить новые теплицы. Дело в том, что у Андрея появилась возможность приобрести землю рядом со своим участком по нормальной цене и он очень хотел бы приобрести ее на будущее, когда будет расширяться через год-два. Андрея можно охарактеризовать как человека активного, трудолюбивого, самостоятельного и смелого, ведь он за несколько лет развил большой бизнес.
texts.en:
Andrey has been growing vegetables on his own plot in Vodyanoye for five years. He has nine large, heated greenhouses where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. 

Andrey studied at the Zaporozhye National Technical University, where he received a degree in mechanical engineering. He worked in his specialty for two years, then decided to focus only on agriculture. He lives with his wife, two sons and mother. 

With the 40,000 UAH, Andrey plans to buy land to further expand his business and build additional greenhouses. Andrey has an opportunity to purchase land adjacent to his site at a normal price, so he would like to buy it for the future, and expand into it in a year or two. Andrey can be described as an active, hardworking, independent and courageous person, as he has developed a great business in just a few years.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to further expand his farming business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn lives in Gapasan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She is operating their own farm, doing this for more than ten years to make a living. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to micro finance services and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Recently, she took a loan to buy fertilizer in order to have a high quality harvest from her rice farm.  

She is thankful for this loan, for it realizes her family's needs for an additional capital for their rice production. She hopes to have a better living condition in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn is 38 years old, married and has two children. She helps her husband in gaining income by buying and reselling meat and frozen foods within her community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children and provide their daily necessities. She wants to acquire more stock of products to sell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to take out a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy dressed chicken, pork, fish and frozen foods to resell. She is hoping that she will avail a loan to be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dressed chicken, pork, fish and frozen foods to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gold and silver to make items of jewelry.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is married and she helps her husband earn a living with her hog raising business. She has been raising hogs for more than four years but she does not earn enough to expand her business. She used her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in order to buy feed for her pigs, and recently took a new loan again to purchase feed. Evangeline plans to expand her business in order to have a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Russel

texts.en: Russel is married with two children, and lives in Zamboanga del Sur. He has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation and rental business for many years to make a living, and he is also engaged in a buy-and-sell business. He joined Gata Daku MPC and took a loan to pay his motorcycle off in full. Having this loan is a big help for Russel to improve the services he has been providing in the business. He hopes to buy a 4-wheel vehicle to be used for his business.

loans.use: to pay his motorcycle off in full

loans.name: Melodie

texts.en: Melodie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling fish in the Philippines. Melodie has been in this business for 3 years now. Melodie requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to sell. Melodie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde que tenía quince años de edad, actualmente realiza esta actividad para  tener ingresos y costear los gastos de su familia, la mayor parte de la cosecha es para consumo familiar y otra parte es para comercializarla; Él es casado, vive con su esposa, un hijo, su nuera y un pequeño nieto.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprara 3 sacos de abono, con lo que dará un mejor desarrollo a la milpa, espera tener mayor productividad, mejores ventas y ganancias con las que podrá ir cancelando sus diferentes compromisos.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, pues es de bahareque (viviendas construida a partir de palos o cañas entretejidos y barro).
texts.en:
Tereso has worked growing corn since he was 15 years old, and currently carries out this activity to have income and pay for his family's expenses. The majority of the harvest is for his family's own consumption, and the other part is to sell. He is married and lives with his wife, his son, his daughter-in-law and his young grandson.

With the money from this loan he will buy three sacks of manure, with which he will improve the cornfield. He hopes to have greater productivity, better sales and earnings with which he can pay his various commitments.

His dream is to improve his home, as he is from a 'bahareque' house (houses constructed from sticks or canes intertwined and mud - 'wattle and daub houses').

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Lanie has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 59 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Marcelina has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business. She has been in this business for 13 years, and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 51-year-old married woman with one child, who is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlyn has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Merlyn requested a 10,500 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more stock of dry goods, like blankets, blouses, etc., to sell. Merlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods, like blankets, blouses, etc., to sell

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru:
Катерине — 24 года. Она занимается выращиванием овощей вместе с дядей и тетей на их участке в г.Каменка уже 5 лет. В основном они выращивают помидоры и огурцы. Дядя и тетя лишились своих детей — оба их сына умерли. В семье Катерины четверо детей и она захотела переехать к тёте, чтобы их поддержать. С тех пор живет у них как дочь. В прошлом году у дяди заболела нога и он не может много работать на огороде, поэтому всю работу там Катерина старается делать вдвоем с тетей. 
Средства в размере 15 000 гривен она планирует вложить в постройку дополнительной теплицы. Это будет вторая большая теплица, в которой со временем нужно будет еще сделать отопление. Катерина хочет вложить полученные от реализации выращенной продукции средства в завершение ремонта в доме, где живет со своими родными, перекрыть там крышу, а также помочь дяде с медицинскими расходами — ему нужно вылечить ногу.
texts.en:
Katerina is 24 years old. She has been growing vegetables along with her aunt and uncle on their plot in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya for five years. They primarily grow tomatoes and cucumbers. Her aunt and uncle lost their children--both of their sons died. Katerina has four children, and she wanted to move in with her aunt to help support them. 

Since she moved in, she is like a daughter to them. Last year, her uncle had medical problems with his leg and now can't do much work on the plot, so Katerina and her aunt try to do all the work there. 

She plans to use the 15,000 UAH to invest in the construction of an additional greenhouse. This will be her second large greenhouse, which will also need a heating system installed. Katerina wants to invest the profits from the sale of products grown to complete the repairing the house where he lives with her family, redo the roof, and help her uncle with medical expenses to treat his leg.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 54 years old, married, and has five children. Two children are still in school. Morita is in an agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. She has been raising cattle for 5 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business.

Morita requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle. In the future, Morita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
С момента вложения в свое дело средств от КИВА в последний раз особенных изменений в бизнесе Игоря не произошло, лишь доход увеличился на 2 000 гривен. 
Сумма в 9 000 гривен нужна Игорю для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно — юбки. Имея больше товара в результате у Игоря будет и больше покупателей.
texts.en:
Since investing his last Kiva loan in his business, Igor's business hasn't substantively changed, but his income has increased by 2,000 UAH.

He plans to use the additional 9,000 UAH to buy seasonal goods--primarily skirts. Having more inventory will help Igor attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase skirts for resale

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gora, est un homme âgé de 66 ans, marié et père de famille. Il habite un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale et vit de l’agriculture qui est sa principale source de revenus depuis des années. Gora possède un espace cultural qu’il exploite toute l’année durant. Il a initié ses enfants dans cette activité et lui ne fait que superviser. En cette période hivernale, il sollicite un crédit à l’IMCEC, pour l’achat de semences d’arachide et de mil.
Gora désire fortement, avoir des machines pour développer son activité, la moderniser et la rendre plus productif.
texts.en: Mr. Gora is a 66 year old man. He is married with children. He lives in a village situated a few kilometers from the main town and earns his living through farming which has been  his principal source of income for several years. Gora owns a plot of land that he cultivates all year long. He has taught his children to farm and now he only supervises them. This winter period, he requests a loan from the IMCEC in order to purchase groundnut and millet seeds. Gora would very much like to have some machines to enable him to develop and modernize his business and render it more productive.

loans.use: to buy seeds for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural  products: seeds, fertiliser for cultivation.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in planting various vegetables for sale. She is now 48 years old and they live happily in a rural community. 

Due to hardship of living, she and her husband aim to increase their production and income in order to sustain the necessities of their family. They plan to expand their vegetable production but they have inadequate capital. 

For this reason, Elena wants to avail a loan a of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. She is hoping that she will avail her loan request to increase their production and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is widowed and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Thelma has been in this business for 23 years now.

Thelma requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like pants, shorts, slippers, shoes, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Thelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like pants, shorts, slippers, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Wonderful lenders! Meet Christine, a 29 year old kind, honest and loving mother of 3 children. Christine hails from the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a very fertile area and has good weather patterns that favor crop and animal farming. Christine is a very hard working woman who has been supporting her family single handedly through farming and making sure that her family gets a decent meal each day.
Christine's primary sources of income are selling milk, crop farming and also she does some small business to make ends meet. Through all these ventures she has been able to always put food on the table for her family. Christine is seeking a loan of KES 31200 to purchase a dairy cow. Because of the increased demand for milk in her area, Christine having an entrepreneur's mind wants to capitalize on that and start selling milk to her neighbors and schools around her village. 
Through the enormous profits that she will gather she will be able to help her family and secure the future of her children. Having gone through the repayment schedule, Christine is very comfortable with the repayments and through this loan her business will flourish.
Christine hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 44 year old, married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Amelita has a chainsaw rental business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline and spare parts for her chainsaw.

Amelita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for her chainsaw

loans.name: Wira Hadi

texts.en:
Wira has dreamed of being a sailor since childhood. Wira lives in a somewhat remote area and far from town. To go to school, he had a 5 km journey using public transportation or bus. 

Wira is concerned that he can not achieve his dreams because of economic factors. His parent is a carpenter who makes household appliances such as cabinets, tables, chairs. His parents make every effort to help Wira achieve his goal as a sailor, but Wira is the second of seven children. He has five siblings who still have a lot of costs for their education. 

Through the student loan program from Kiva, Wira hopes to finish college and get a job on a fast ship. He is very grateful to the investors of Kiva because, thanks to their loans, he can cover the cost of college and is not going to waste this opportunity. Wira is eager to help his siblings to be able to complete their schooling.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr:
Saliou, marié et père de famille, vit dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. Il s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plusieurs années déjà. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et pour une fois, il sollicite ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter des intrants agricoles et de cultiver son espace. Saliou évolue dans l’agriculture, mais aussi dans l’élevage (activité moins développé), ce qui lui permet de se nourrir lui et sa famille.
S’il a les moyens, il aimerait développer son activité d’élevage (volaille, ovins et caprins).
texts.en:
Saliou, who is married with children, lives in a village situated a few kilometers from the main town. He has been farming for several years now. He has never had the benefit of an IMCEC loan and for once, he requests a loan in order to be able to buy seeds and fertiliser to cultivate his plot of land. Saliou is a cereal farmer, but he also does a bit of livestock farming (on a smaller scale), which enables him to feed his family.
If it were financially possible, he would like to expand his livestock business (fowl, ovine and caprine).

loans.use: to buy products for farming.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 37,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Agripina hopes that her business will grow bigger so she can add more computers. She dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. This is where she finds strength from the Word of God she and her co-fellowship members study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tessie hopes to have additional tricycles and dreams of having a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support her family. Warlita is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Warlita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Warlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Chonita

texts.en:
Chonita is 49 years old and married with two children.  

Chonita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Chonita requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Chonita has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Chonita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements and poultry

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more bales of clothes for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi appreciates for her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.
She would like to apply for a loan to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Asief Nor

texts.en:
To become a sailor had been a dream since childhood for Asief. Asief lives in a somewhat remote village called Village Sadang, located in the Kudus city. To go to the old school, he had to travel 1 km on foot. Asief now lives with a stepmother who is only selling snacks in the house. Both biological parents have died. His mother died at the time of class 1 when Asief was still in elementary school, because of a heart attack. His father died when Asief was in class IX in junior high school, due to a throat infection. 

Asief has six siblings. Although his stepmother is not the biological mother of Asief, she made every effort to help Asief achieve his desire and goal as a sailor. 

Currently Asief has already been received in the Academy of Maritim Nusantara (AMN) and due to the condition of his family, he joined the Kiva student loan program. Through the program, Asief hopes to finish college and get a job at a fast ship. He is very grateful to the investors of Kiva, because thanks to their loans, he can cover the cost of college and is not going to waste this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Rex, her husband, helps her to manage their household. Michelle offers manicures and pedicures in her community and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

Michelle has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She does home service. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

Michelle is requesting a loan to purchase materials needed in her business like nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and others. She will use her loan to improve her service and her additional revenue.

In the future, Michelle wants to improve the general living condition of her family and provide the best education for her children.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and other materials needed in her nail business.

loans.name: Risna

texts.en:
Risna is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He wants to work in a large port. Risna lives in a remote village in a mountainous area called Mount Muria, precisely in the area of Kudus, Central Java. Risna lives with his mother and brother. His father divorced his mother. His mother is a small food vendor at her home to meet the daily needs of their family. His mother's income is erratic and only enough to finance the day-to-day life. Risna has one sister who is still in need of education expenditures. 

Risna is eager to help his mother, so he is determined to continue his studies. With the consent of his mother, he enrolled at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN) and the student loan program. With the student loan program from Kiva, he wants to pursue his studies and complete quickly, in order to quickly get the job he desires. He is very grateful to all investors of Kiva, who have helped in his study even though they do not know him personally.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Susette

texts.en:
Susette is 43 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are in school. 

Susette is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Susette requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susette has been in pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Susette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en:
Buenaventura is 59 years old and married with four children. Buenaventura works very hard to provide for them.

Buenaventura runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioner, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Buenaventura has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Buenaventura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioner, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

Sofia would like to apply for a loan to buy more bales of clothes for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leónidas, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos para abastecer a su familia y el resto lo comercializa para tener ingresos económicos, en su hogar es el único que trabaja, vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijas; en su negocio trabaja solo, eventualmente contrata mozos para que le ayuden, su negocio funciona desde hace 30 años, en horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, es un oficio que heredó de su padre.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de insumos agrícolas, como insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, para preparar la tierra y cultivar granos básicos, espera que su cosecha sea abundante para tener mejores ganancias y asegurar una mejor alimentación para su familia.
Anhela ampliar el área de siembra, cancelar su crédito y dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Leónidas works growing basic grains to supply his family and the rest he sells to have income. He is the only person who works in his house. He lives with his life companion and their children. He works alone in his business. Sometimes he hires labor to help him. He has been farming for 30 years and it is something he learned from his father. His timetable is from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.

He will invest the capital in buying agricultural inputs like insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, manure and seeds. to prepare the earth for planting and grow basic grains. He hopes to have an abundant crop so he can have higher profits and secure better food for his family. He hopes to expand his growing area, pay off his loan and provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Ricardo Edenilson

texts.es:
Ricardo, se encuentra acompañado, vive con su pareja, un hijo y su padre; se dedica a la ganadería también cultiva maíz, frijol, tomates y chiles, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su padre, tiene ocho años de trabajar independiente, por el momento su negocio no representa dificultades.
Necesita el capital para comprar semilla, plantas de chile, abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas e insecticidas, son implementos importantes para realizar sus cultivos, continuar aumentando su productividad, tener ganancias mayores mejorar su estabilidad económica y familiar.
Su visión es incorporar poco a poco otro tipo de cultivo, construir su casa propia y dar a su familia mejores circunstancias de vida.
texts.en: Ricardo is married. He livers with his wife, their son, and his father. Ricardo makes a living raising livestock and cultivating corn, beans, tomatoes, and chilis. He learned this trade from his father. Ricardo has been working independently for eight years and, so far, he has not had any problems. He needs capital to buy seeds, chili plants, compost, fertilizers, and insecticides. These are important for harvesting his crops, increasing his production, and increasing his earnings to improve his family's financial stability. Ricardo's vision is to incorporate, little by little, other types of crops, to build his own house, and to provide a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chili plants, compost, fertilizer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Felicitas tiene 42 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, leche entre otros, la socia a la vez es docente de profesion,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusi Ccoyllor” which is located in the District of Vilcabamba in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is 42 years old, single, and has three children. Felicitas divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. She sells all types of products such as rice, milk, and other items. At the same time, she is a teacher by profession. Felicitas wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, oil, and other products. Felicitas is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is married, with two school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanapili has operated a clothes-selling business for the past three years. She sells at the market to her town-dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda, 59, is a micro-entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Oscar, who works as an employee. God has blessed them with four children, who are no longer in school.

Blesilda manages the household, together with her husband, while operating a food-stall business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Blesilda's regular customers are her neighbors and members of  the local community. She earns a minimum 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat homecooked meals in the evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugality. It is considered a waste of money and time to buy food and use cooking gas for one to two people when buying cooked rice and meats costs less than raw food. 

To help her continue operating her business, Blesilda is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen foods. 

Blesilda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her house will be renovated. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen foods.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Cecelia is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Ma. Cecelia has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years.

Ma. Cecelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, Ma. Cecelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es:
José, vive solo, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, los cueles viven con su madre, él es divorciado, pero siempre está al pendiente lo que sus hijos necesitan; se dedica a tender su taller de estructuras metálicas y a hacer trabajos de albañilería, su negocio nace por la necesidad de tener ingresos económicos para solventar sus diferentes gasto y ya tiene 23 años de estar funcionando, su horario es de 6:30 a.m. a 2:30 p.m.
Con el financiamiento comprara palas, cucharas, tubos, láminas, hierro, electrodos, etc., así se mantendrá realizando los trabajos de pendientes y mejorara su puntualidad, espera recuperar la inversión con mejores ganancias que serán utilizadas para pagar sus cuotas.
Su sueño es trabajar mucho para mantener su negocio funcionando, tener los recursos económicos para costear sus gastos y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
José lives alone.  He has two children, ages eight and five, and they live with their mother.  He is divorced, but he is always vigilant of their needs.  He tends to a metallic structure workshop and he does bricklaying jobs.  His business was born from the need to have income to pay for their different expenses.  His business has been functioning for 23 years.  His schedule is from 6:30 a.m. until 2:30 p.m.

He will use the loan to buy shovels, buckets, pipes, laminated metal sheeting, iron, and electrodes, etc.  This way he will keep doing the outstanding jobs, and he will improve his punctuality.  He expects to recover the investment with better earnings that will be used to make his payments.

His dream is to work a lot in order to keep his business functioning, to have the financial resources to pay for his expenses, and to help his children with their education.

loans.use: to buy shovels, buckets, pipes, laminated metal sheeting, iron, and electrodes, etc.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou est un jeune éleveur, marié et père de famille. Il habite dans un village situé à des kilomètres de la ville principale. Il possède un troupeau de bœufs dont il s’occupe particulièrement et peut en tirer soit du lait des vaches pour revendre, soit des bœufs à terme qu’il peut revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 
Mamadou a entamé des travaux de construction dans son village, c’est d’ailleurs la raison pour laquelle, il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des matériaux de construction et pouvoir terminer la maison et y déménager avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a young cattle breeder.  He is married and he has a family.  He lives in a village located miles away from the main city.  He owns a herd of cattle which he takes very good care of.  Thanks to his cattle, he produces milk for resale and also periodically resells young bulls at the weekly markets.

Mamadou has started to build a house in his village.  This is the reason why he is taking this loan:  he would like to buy building supplies to finish the construction of his house and move in it with his family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies for his house.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena está estudiando por la mañana, y trabaja por la tarde con su mamá en la Despensa que tiene en su casa.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería con la que quiere abrirse camino y poder el día de mañana ayudar a las demás personas.
Lorena pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de manutención, como ser libros, matrícula y demás, ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de estudiar y crecer.
texts.en:
Lorena is studying for the future. In the afternoons, she works with her mother at a food pantry that is set up in their house.

Lorena is studying for a degree in Nursing because she wants to open doors and be able to help other people someday. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in expenses such as books, tuition, and other items. Lorena is extremely grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can study and grow.

loans.use: to pay for books, tuition, and other items.

loans.name: Mary An

texts.en:
Mary An is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns income from raising pigs. 

Mary An has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Mary An has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics for his tailor's shop (for sewing and resale).

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos: Es un señor amable, soltero con 2 hijos mayores de edad. Trabaja en el gobierno municipal, desde hace 4 años alquila un cuarto, pagando una mensualidad de C$2,000 (Dos mil Córdobas mensuales). Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción, con el propósito de tener su propia vivienda: cemento, hierro y cubrir costos de transporte a la comunidad de San José de Kukalaya, ubicada a 13 kilómetros del municipio de Rosita, equivalente a hora y media. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a friendly man who is single and has two grown children. He works for the municipal government and has been renting a room for the past four years, paying 2,000 NIO each month.

Juan Carlos is requesting his first loan so that he can buy construction materials with the intention of having a house of his own. He will buy cement, iron, and also pay for the transport costs to the community of San José de Kukalaya, which is 13 kilometers from the town of Rosita, the equivalent of an hour-and-a-half trip. His dream is to finish the construction of his concrete house.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, and to pay the cost of transporting these materials.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza was able to sustain her six children's education, when they were studying, through her retailing business. Esperanza has been running her business for 20 years and is proud to share that, through her business and with her husband's help, all her children finished their education and are degree holders. 

Esperanza sells grocery items in their village. She wants to continue operating the business, while she can manage it, for a continuous source of income. Esperanza is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy beverages, spices, condiments, curls, and many more items. She hopes to increase her income to have savings to be used for any future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy beverages, spices, condiments, curls, and many more items.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
La socia Verónica pertenece al banco comunal LAS ORQUIDEAS,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana ,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Verónica tiene 37 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chocolate en pasta, la socia elabora y distribuye a sus clientes que le solicitan, como amistades, familiares y clientes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Verónica belongs to the communal bank group "Las Orquideas," located in the Santa Ana district, in the province of La Convención, and the department of Cusco.

Verónica is 37 years old and has two children. She is a single mother who works selling chocolate paste. She makes and distributes her product to friends, family members, and customers who order it. Verónica has been working in this business for a long time and it has gone well for her thanks to the determination she shows each day. She hopes to be able to keep working in this business to keep supporting her family. 

Verónica is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients such as sugar and other items. She is grateful for the loan offered to her and pledges to complete all of her scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
This is Mupa. She previously accessed a loan that she used in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more grocery items for resale. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is a 23-year-old married woman with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. She runs a produce business dealing in beans, peas, groundnuts, and maize. She has been in her business for three years. She supplements her income with farming and motorcycle transport. Silvia began the businesses to make income for her family. She is a hardworking woman wishing to expand her business into a busy center; however, limited capital is a challenge. She intends to use this loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Kitagwenda Head Teachers Association Group

texts.en:
Deogratius is a hard-working man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening and selling, alongside his salary earnings. He started this business to increase his income and have better standards of living. He faces hardships such as bad weather, theft of his cows and dry seasons, which affect his cattle. He has a vision of expanding his farm.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening for his farm. He is a member of Kitagwenda Head Teachers Association where they have group guarantorship.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening for his farm.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Angelita has been raising livestock for 9 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Necia

texts.en:
Necia is a 45-year old micro-entrepreneur, who is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Dominador, her business partner, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Necia operates a business selling bridal gowns. What she basically does is buy bridal gown products from her suppliers and sell them per item at a profit. Her products are bridal gowns and dresses. Her regular customers are people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

Necia dreams of having other stalls in different locations and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wooden formwork, props and wood planks for construction.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar pescado, camarones, arena, leña, pedales, llantas, pintura, parches y otros repuestos para bicicletas, de esta manera seguirá fabricando ladrillos, vendiendo pescado y reparando bicicletas para luego venderlas, se mantendrá trabajando y cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Con el capital anterior su negocio se fortaleció, mejoro sus ingresos, cancelo la deuda adquirida y su familia tiene  un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Juan is requesting another loan in order to buy fish, shrimp, sand, wood, pedals, tires, paint, patches, and other spare bike parts. In this way, he will continue manufacturing bricks, selling fish, and repairing bicycles to later sell. He will keep working to cover his family's basic expenses. With the capital from his previous loan, Juan strengthened his business, improved his income, paid off his debt, and gave his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, sand, wood, pedals, tires, paint, patches, and other spare bike parts.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Judith has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and items for her food-vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and items for her food-vending business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 51 years old and married with four children, with one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Judith runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, sugar, vinegar, shampoo, and hair conditioner. 
 
Judith has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kibosho Group

texts.en:
Anna, a mother of two school-aged children, is married and in her late forties. She is currently running two businesses. Her first business is goat selling; she buys, keeps and sells goats. A beauty salon is her second business. Anna has been in these businesses for one year and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy goats to resell.  She wants to buy more animals for the coming Muslim ceremony Idd Mubaraka. Goats are more in demand now, especially by bars and big hotels, so she needs to purchase more to meet demand. She used the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to buy fabrics and goats. Anna did a good job and earned a profit, which she used to cover part of her family's school fees and home food expenses. She dreams of opening a successful project.

She will share this loan with her loan group Kibosho, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats to resell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 36 years old and a mother of three. She is separated from her husband due to unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she has the determination to give her family a better life. She owns and manages a small retail store selling grocery items, fruits and vegetables in the local community. She aims to improve her business to increase her income. 

Marilou would like to increase her product offerings but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and grocery items to resell. She is hoping that through this loan she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and grocery items to resell

loans.name: Mely

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Mely supported her husband in planting various vegetables for sale. She is 56 years old and has five adult-age children. They aimed to increase their production and income in order to sustain their daily needs and save some for their children's future. They want to expand their plantation, but they have insufficient capital. For this reason, Mely is requesting for a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in planting  vegetables. Through this loan, Mely believes that they will be able to increase their production and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for vegetable production

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina opened her mini-shop in 2012 through her own work. She lives in a town with her family and generates a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of being involved in business. 

A 600 USD loan is offered to Marcelina to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, like bags, shirts, trousers, and shorts.

loans.use: To buy bags, shirts, trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Iragi 2 Group

texts.fr: Itongwa est une commerçante depuis 10 ans, trésorière et membre d’une banque villageoise «Iragi 2», âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère des 10 enfants, dont 8 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des fournitures scolaires, de bureaux et propriétaire d’un magasin dans le centre ville. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. Elle va  acheter des cahiers, des blocks notes, des rames de papiers, des flips chats, des stylos, des consommables informatiques etc. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Itongwa has been a merchant for ten years and is the treasurer and a member of the banque villageoise named Iragi 2. She is 38 years old, married to a driver, and a mother of ten children. Eight of the children go to school while the other two are already grown.

Itongwa sells school and office supplies and owns a shop in the center of town. She started this business with funds from her husband. She is seeking a loan with Hekima. She is going to buy notebooks, spiral notebooks, reams of paper, "flip chats," pencils, and IT supplies.

In the future, she wishes to increase her business and educate and feed her children.

Finally, Itongwa thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, spiral notebooks, reams of paper, flip chats, pencils, and  IT supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Catalina has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chiregano est présidente dans le groupe de crédit Ukweli. Mère de 9 enfants scolarisés, elle est âgée de 42 ans et mariée à un agent de l’Etat Congolais. Vendeuse de yaourt depuis 2005, elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 85 litres de yaourt. Son objectif est de rehabiliter sa maison, nourrir sa famille et supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur. Elle remercie Hekima pour les activités en faveur des femmes démunies économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Chiregano is the president of the Ukweli group. A mother of nine children who go to school, Chiregano is 42 years old and married to a public service agent.

Chiregano has been selling yogurt since 2005 and is seeking a loan to buy 85 liters of yogurt. 

Her goal is to renovate her home, feed her family, and cover her children's school fees until high school.

She thanks Hekima for their support of working, poor women.

loans.use: to buy 85 liters of yogurt

loans.name: Gemarie

texts.en: Gemarie is 22 years old and married with one child. She operates a store selling grocery items to the people in their village. Gemarie is thankful for a small business she operates because she was able to acquire income for daily meals. Gemarie wanted to sell more items, but had insufficient funds so she is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits and soap to sell. She hopes to keep increasing her sales and gain good profits for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits and soap to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and blessed with eight school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Fatuma has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gents suits for sale at home. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: Madame Faida trésorière du groupe de crédit Safina est vendeuse de divers produits vivriers au marché. Agée de 45 ans, elle est mariée  à un homme sans profession et ensemble ils ont 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 1 panier de tomate, 1 bidon d’huile de palme, 20kg d’oignon et 20kg d’arachide. Les revenus de ce prêt lui permettront de construire une maison et d’agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur  de son œuvre grandiose en faveur des femmes.
texts.en:
Faida is the treasurer of the Safina group and works selling various food products at the market. At 45 years old, she is married to a husband without a profession and together they have four children, who all go to school.

Faida is seeking a loan to buy one tray of tomatoes, one drum of palm oil, 20 kilograms of onions, and 20 kilograms of groundnuts. 

Earnings from this loan will allow her to build a house and expand her business.

Faida thanks Hekima with all her heart for their great work helping women.

loans.use: to buy one tray of tomatoes, one drum of palm oil, 20 kilograms of onions, and 20 kilograms of groundnuts

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de 62 años de edad, madre de 12 hijos 8 varones y 4 hembras todos mayores de edad y con su propia familia, ella es casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura comenta que con mucho trabajo de su esposo y ella han logrado crecer a sus 12 hijos, el nivel de estudio que tiene ella es de quinto grado pues su padres no quisieron mandarla más a la escuela, a ellos les bastaba con que aprendiera a leer por eso la enviaban a pastear el ganado que tenía su padre y no tenía tiempo para estudiar.

 Actualmente en su vivienda solo vive su esposo, su hija menor y una nieta y son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.
 
Hoy que  ya todos sus  hijos están mayores y casados, ella no realiza otro oficio que no sea los oficios domésticos en su casa y cuidar de su esposo y su nieta comenta que desde estaba pequeña su madre le enseño esta actividad que la desempeña a la perfección y cuando sus hijos estaban pequeño tenía que trabajar fuera de su casa para obtener ingresos al igual que su esposo tenían que trabajar mucho para mantener a su 12 hijos, hoy en día 7 de ellos  están fuera del país trabajando y le aportan económicamente a ella y su esposo para realizar los trabajos en la agricultura siembra de maíz y frijol 

El financiamiento del crédito lo invertirá en remodelación de su vivienda específicamente en la construcción de una cocina pues la que tiene no reúne las condiciones necesarias y en esta época de lluvia le entra agua y se le mojan las pertenencias, ella comprara 500 bloques, 15 bolsas de cemento, 2 quintales de hierro,  7 metros de arena, una camionada de piedra y la mano de obra.
 
Teresa tiene sueños desea seguir remodelando para sus nietos, tener la casa bien remodelada también desea salir del país e ir a visitar a sus hijos a los estados unidos junto con su esposo, que sus hijos sean personas de bien al igual que sus nietos y tener mejores cultivos en sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Teresa, 62 years of age, is the mother of 12 children, 8 male and 4 female who are all now adults and have their own family. She is married; her husband makes a living in agriculture. She comments that with lots of work her husband and she have managed to raise their 12 children. The level of schooling that she has is fifth grade, as her parents didn't want to keep sending her to school, as to them it was enough that she had learned to read, so they sent her to graze the cattle that her father had and she didn't have time for school. 

Now in her home there only lives her husband, her youngest daughter and a granddaughter, and they are the only people who depend on her.
 
Now that all of her children are older and married, she doesn't have another job other than domestic chores and taking care of her husband and granddaughter.  She comments that since she was little her mother taught her these activities so she does them perfectly, and when her children were little she had to work outside of the house to make an income, and the same with her husband who had to work very hard to support their 12 children. Now, 7 of them work abroad and they economically support her and her husband so they can do the farm work of cultivating maize and beans.  

This loan will be invested in remodeling her home, specifically in the construction of a kitchen as the one that she has doesn't meet the necessary conditions, and this rainy season water entered the house and soaked their belongings.
