She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is 29 years old and has a live-in partner with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Ria is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream--to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bilhah

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Bilhah, a hardworking mother of two children who has been farming for the last five years so that she can supplement her income from the salary she gets. Bilhah farms crops and keeps cattle, and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges, though, are disease and lack of finances to improve her farming

This has led her to seek a loan of 10,000 KES to be able to purchase a goat. She projects that by the end of the year the goat will have given birth to at least four other goats. Through goat keeping, she will be able to get goat milk, which is very expensive and fetches high profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also she will be able to sell goat meat and goat skin, which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a goat

loans.name: Keren

texts.en: Keren lives in Masindi, Uganda. She has a bar and sells milk to generate more income. She started the business to earn a living and educate her children since she is a single mother. Inadequate capital and high license fees affect her business. Being a determined woman, Keren needs this loan to buy drinks such as soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 56-year-old widow woman from the village of Jughaani. She lives with her mother-in-law, who gets social assistance for law rates of her living condition. The only activity they are involved is horticulture. Specifically, they own a small garden where they seasonally seed vegetables and greens, and use harvested products for local trading. 

In order to increase her income and get a chance for improving her family's living condition, Lali requested a loan. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives rural people chance to start or re-start businesses. She will use this mentioned loan for purchasing a stock of clothing and start a trading business. 

Lali will be able to generate some income for covering family expenses and somehow increase her standard of living. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 22-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin city. His family works as farmers on their land. They plans seasonal goods and resell them in the market. 

Anas is a student in a local university where he studies business adminstration. He would like to take the B.A. degree and find a job as a teacher in the future to help his family and improve their living conditions.

Anas took a USD loan from FATEN (Palestine for Credit & Development). This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Anas will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.

Anas appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Due to financial insufficiency, Agustina engages in making and selling soft brooms to help her husband in generating income. They aimed to uplift their poor status of living in order to give their children a better life. In this regard, she wants to make more soft brooms to sell but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she wants to take a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy more tiger grass, rattan, and plastics needed in making soft brooms. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will strengthen the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more tiger grass, rattan and plastics needed in making soft brooms.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting cassava and vegetables to sell. She was able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her farm. She earns well from her investment and she was also able to save for their future.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy farming materials and other supplies needed for her business. Her profits will definitely help her meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julita hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to give her family a good future. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she has repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income and to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of  the franchise agreement / permit so she can continue her business operation.

In the future, Teresa hopes that her business will continue to operate. She also dreams to give her children a good and quality education. Each week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle transportation business.

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucilyn is 42 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. 

Lucilyn requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan amount through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lucilyn has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothes.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell at her business.

Rosela has been in this business for 14 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Gada

texts.en:
Gada is a 20-year-old single young lady from Jabalia. Her father is a worker where he gets a low income. Gada is a student in a local university where she studies English literature. She would like to take a BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future to help her family and improve their living conditions.

Gada took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Gada will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

Gada appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

In relation to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of 17,000 PHP to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Katlyn dreams of having a bigger store and hopes to give her child a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Om Helmi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Helmi. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER (Yemeni Rials) from AMB (Al-Amal Microfinance Bank). 

Fadia is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, and she is living with them in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She works as a housewife, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. Over time, Fadia and her husband purchased a piece of land and built their house on it. That business cost them a lot of money. 

Unfortunately, most the rooms in the house are without windows and doors. This lets the rain, sunshine, flies, fireflies, and bad bugs come into the house and cause the sickness of her children. Now, they need to a financial support to complete the house and renovate it to get in good condition and to be more safe. As a result, Fadia is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase windows and doors to complete the renovation of her house.

Fadia dreams in the future of building one more floor and renovating it.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors to complete the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Roda Faith

texts.en:
Roda Faith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Roda Faith has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Roda Faith would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Antonio Rafael

texts.es:
Antonio es un diligente empleado en una tienda de calzado y artículos de cuero, lleva trabajando allí alrededor de 5 años buscando ingresos para sobrevivir.
Su jefe le ofreció la oportunidad de comprar dicho negocio y adquirir toda la mercancía que allí se vende, ya que Antonio tiene gran experiencia en este campo, desea comprarlo y obtener así esa independencia que tanto ha soñado.
Solicita el préstamo precisamente para eso, comprar el negocio ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente.
Es un joven muy emprendedor y laborioso, nunca ha tenido problema alguno con el desarrollo de su trabajo.
texts.en: Antonio is a diligent worker in a shoe and leather goods store. He has been working there for about 5 years earning money to survive. His boss has offered him the opportunity to buy the business and acquire all the stock that is for sale. As Antonio has much experience on the field, he wants to buy it and become independent as he has dreamed of. He is requesting the loan to do exactly that, buy the business, as he does not have sufficient capital. He is entrepreneurial and hard-working,. He has never had a problem in carrying out his work.

loans.use: to buy a shoe business that is for sale.

loans.name: Naileen

texts.en:
Naileen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Naileen has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and has four children. She is married, and two of her children are currently in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming rice for 12 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools of the trade like a more modern straightening iron, curling tongs, combs and hairclips amongst other items.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Teresa, a caring 24-year-old mother and a darling to her four children and family. She lives in Nyamira area of Kenya, an area known for banana planting and their staple food, “matoke”, which is made from bananas. She has been doing farming for the past twelve years, and she enjoys every bit of it. Through tea, crops and personal business, she has been able to earn a decent income and be able to provide for her young family.

Although Teresa has been practicing farming for the past twelve years, she has always faced one uphill task, and that is inadequate capital to improve her farming. Due to this condition, she is requesting a loan of KES 20,800 to purchase a dairy cow, which will help in milk production. She will be able to sell products from milk, such as yoghurt.

Teresa has an entrepreneur’s mind, and this has helped her to be able to identify a market for milk and milk products in her area. Through this, she will be able to earn more money, and this will translate into improved living standards for her family.

Teresa’s projections are that through the profits she would be making, she will be able to save enough money to be able to one day open a yoghurt-making plant. Through the profits earned, Teresa will be able to comfortably repay the loan without any trouble.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products for her coffee and vegetable plants

loans.name: Bernadete

texts.en:
Bernadete is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and has three children. This is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits, bread and biscuits. 

Bernadete opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income, and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and bread.

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anelita has been pig fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lolita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell in her purified water business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Jhohan Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JHOHAN” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Guayaramerin, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yancarla es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de dulce, venta de perfumes, venta de plástico.

Después de la inundación que hubo en Guayaramerin muchas microempresarias fueron afectadas, ya que perdieron gran parte de su mercadería y sus herramientas de trabajo. La señora Yancarla  indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución; Ella cuenta que después de este desastre natural, que afecto a su familia,  ella decidió retomar su actividad económica, ya que es su única fuente de producción; el negocio que tiene es la venta de comida, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años al observar que sus productos son muy requeridos por sus vecinos decidió emprenderlo de nuevo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de compra de utensilios de cocina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad del Beni y posteriormente implementará en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo que le ofrece la institución para restablecer su negocio y cuidar su salud con los consultorios médicos.
texts.en:
The “JHOHAN” communal bank is starting their 4th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Guayaramerin regional branch. It is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors with Yancarla as the president. The member’s of the communal bank businesses are varied, amongst them are: food sales, clothing sales, the sale of sweets, selling perfume and selling plastic goods.

After the flooding that happened in Guayaramerin many micro-enterprises were affected as they lost the greater part of their merchandise and their work tools. Yancarla indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She says that after this natural disaster which affected her family, she decided to restart her economic activity as it is her only source of productivity. Her business is selling meals. She states that she started the business five years ago, observing that her products were much in demand by her neighbors so she decided to sell them.

The loan she is now requesting is to increase her working capital (buying kitchen utensils) that she will buy at the wholesalers in the city of Beni and later she will use them in her business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has two children. When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the support the institution is offering her to reestablish her business and she likes the health care and medical consultations.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a room for her children.

loans.name: Domnic

texts.en:
Domnic is a 29-year-old single man who has been operating a charcoal sales business for five years. He earns an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month. 
  
Domnic was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy additional charcoal to add to his stock and sell to his customers on a daily basis.  

The profits he earns will enable him to buy his own land, and hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal stock to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hard-working mother who supports her husband in gaining income. She engages herself in making and selling soft brooms within the local community. Due to insufficient income, she wants to make her business more profitable in order to increase her income. She wants to make more stocks of soft brooms to sell, but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, she wants to access a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy more stocks of tiger grass, rattan, and plastics needed in making soft brooms. She believes that this will let her produce more stocks of soft brooms through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tiger grass, rattan, and plastics needed in making soft brooms.

loans.name: Fátima Gabriela

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2  años, el mayor  estudia en escuela. El marido es maestro electricista. 
Doña Fátima con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella vende a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Este negocio lo empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que esto le esta ayudado a salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos. Ella lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the sector known as Estancia Vieja in the Colon parish within the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank “Estancia Vieja” meet every 15 days. The humble people who live in this place are devoted to agriculture and general trade.

Sra. Fátima lives in this place. She is 27 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 5 and 2). Her older child is in school. Her husband is a master electrician.

With the intent of earning some income on her own and helping her husband with the household expenses, Doña Fátima began selling shoes through catalogs by going door-to-door. She also sells from her home to customers who visit her. Fátima sells on credit and collects payment every 15 days. She started this business with one of the loans she received from her group. For this reason, she is very grateful that it helped her and her family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy shoes. Fátima has participated in three loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because she was able to start her business. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is self-employed and from Sayat Nova village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband and his relatives. Kristine has been running a farm for many years. She is also engaged in animal husbandry and keeps cattle, pigs and hens. This large family tries hard to make ends meet, as agriculture is its only revenue source. 

In order to sustain her agribusiness and expand it, Kristine has applied for a loan of USD 3,000. This amount will be used to pay for 30 bags of fertilizers, pesticides and cucumber seeds, and finance the soil-plowing process. 

As this is Kristine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (30 bags), pesticides and cucumber seeds, and finance the soil-plowing process.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional stocks, like bread, sugar, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, like bread, sugar, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUSI CCOYLLOR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Dominga tiene 59 años de edad tiene 08 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusi Ccoyllor” which is located in the District of Vilcabamba in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She is 59 years old, married, and has eight children. Dominga divides her time between her daily activities and her farming duties. She has been at her business for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Dominga wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost and seeds. Dominga is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a 29-year-old woman and is married to Anthony who provides additional income for the family. Together, they are blessed with two children aged 12 and 6 years old. Jacklyne has been operating a beauty shop business for four years earning an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings) at the end of every month.

Jacklyne is now servicing her third loan of 45,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional beauty products to add to her stock. She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and open a beauty shop in her nearby town to serve her community.  

Jacklyne hopes to expand her business by providing both retail and wholesale service of beauty products to her customers and to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to add additional beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store at her general store business.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from selling food.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious breads and cakes for his family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de encarnación, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que a la vez que estudia también está trabajando, ya que esta es la única forma para poder salir adelante.
Su principal meta es poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas que necesiten de ella. Es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo ya que con el podrá pagar sus gastos de titulación, lo cual implica un gasto que quiere cubrir. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiar y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Encarnación. She is studying for a degree in Business Administration. Maria says that she is studying and working at the same time since this is the only way for her to get ahead.

Her main goal is to become a professional who is useful to society and to other people who need her. She is a determined and hardworking individual who strives to move forward.

Maria is requesting this loan in order to pay for her degree expenses that she needs to cover. She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received to study and accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 57 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now in their adult years. 

Jessie has been engaged in managing a beauty parlor and a sari-sari store (variety store) that sells groceries and other consumable products for five years already and earns approximately 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cosmetics and accessories for the beauty parlor and stocks of groceries and other consumable goods for retail.

Jessie has been a member of PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative) for four years. In the future, Jessie hopes to expand her sari-sari store and beauty parlor business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional cosmetics and accessories for the beauty parlor and stocks of groceries and other consumable goods.

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en:
Armelinda is a 26-year-old mother who was gifted with two children. She owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. Due to high cost commodities, she aims to make her business more profitable in order to satisfy her family's daily necessities and to save some for the future of her children. 

She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell, but she don't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell. Being  a patient and industrious mother, she believes this will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mora

texts.en:
This is Mora, 63, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Heracleo and a mother to her six children. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mora is a rice retail dealer. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the kilo. Aside from the rice, she also earns from selling water and soft drinks and also by operating their own room rental business. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 450 PHP (Philippine Pesos) in sales every day. Mora appears here in a photo at her water business.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of rice and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mora hopes that she will be able to grow her business so she can easily repay all her debts and loans. She also hopes to be always healthy and fit for work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products, like rice, soft drinks, and many others that are needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José,  solicita más capital que en esta oportunidad lo utilizara para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas, así realizara la siembra de granos básicos con los que brindara una buena alimentación a su familia y podrá vender el resto.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a realizar la compra de cerdos y concentrado, con lo que mejoro su negocio, su situación económica es mejor, junto a su familia viven en mejores circunstancias. Ya cuenta con un empleo fijo, pero eso no evita que sigua atendiendo sus propias actividades económicas en su tiempo libre y su familia le apoya en ello.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting more capital that he will use, on this occasion, to purchase manure, seed, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides. In this way, he will sow basic grains with which to provide a good diet for his family, and he will be able to sell the rest.

The previous loan helped him to buy pigs and concentrated feed, with which he improved his business. His economic situation is better. He lives with his family in better circumstances. 

He has a permanent job now, but that does not prevent him from continuing to look after his own economic activities in his spare time, and his family supports him on that.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia previously accessed a 50,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan that she utilized to buy fertilizer and materials for her farming business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and materials for her farming business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aurelia hopes to always have a good harvest and dreams of having an abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and materials for her farming business.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in 1972. She is widowed. Mahbuba raises three children alone. She works hard because she must earn her living alone. She is an entrepreneur. 

Mahbuba sells children's clothes in a local market. She buys clothes in bulk and sells them in a local market. Mahbuba renews the assortment of her goods every season and in this way, she attracts customers. Mahbuba has been working in this way more than eight years. 

Mahbuba is going to buy children's clothes for the new season, so she is asking for a loan of 4,700 Tajikistani Somonis (TJS). She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.es: Basilisa: Es una señora luchadora. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace más de 4 años estableció su pequeña tienda de ropa nueva. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua: blusas, pantalones, shorts, ropa interior, entre otros productos y distribuir sus productos en las comunidades del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Basilisa is a determined woman. With the intent of having her own source of income, she started a small clothing store more than four years ago. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise in Managua. These items include blouses, trousers, shorts, undergarments, and other items.

She will distribute her products in the communities within the town of Puerto Cabezas. Basilisa dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, shorts, undergarments, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Noemy

texts.es:
Carmen,  surtió con variedad de prendas de vestir su negocio y mejoro económicamente, son efectos positivos que tuvo al utilizar el crédito anterior, ya ha dejado de ser empleada, hoy en día se dedica a vender pupusas y ropa, su familia tiene  mejorar alimentación, salud y vestuario.
Se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para continuar mejorando su negocio, comprara repollo, tomates, aderezos, bebidas, quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, harina, aceite y nuevos estilos de ropa, tendrá todo lo necesario para seguir generando los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante..
texts.en:
Carmen stocked her business with a variety of clothing items, and improved financially. These are positive results that she had from the use of her previous loan. 

She is no longer employed, nowadays she works selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and garments. Her family enjoys a better diet, health and wardrobe.

She decided to get a new loan to continue improving her business. She will buy cabbage, tomatoes, seasoning, beverages, farmer cheese, pork rinds, corn, flour, oil, and new styles of clothing. She will have everything needed to continue generating income to get ahead..

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, seasoning, beverages, farmer cheese, pork rinds, corn, flour, oil, and new styles of clothing.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
From the  village of Ayntap in the Ararat region, Lusine is divorced and lives with her 14-year-old son. Self-employed, she has been engaged in the retail trade of women's clothing and shoes for many years.

Lusine had taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to repay it. However, over the course of years of tireless work, she established her own business, which is profitable enough to now cover monthly repayments. 

Lusine wants to expand her business a little bit and has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. With the loan's help, she is planning to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Houleye's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint son septième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce, la fabrication de savon traditionnel et la culture sous pluie.

Madame Houlèye (assise à extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Elle est revendeuse de sucre, de thé vert, de bouillions culinaires et de batterie pour recharge de torche et divers. Elle achète sa marchandise dans un marché hebdomadaire de la sous région en gros et demi gros  pour la revente par détail chez elle dans le village. Elle jouit d’une expérience de plus de cinq dans  ce domaine d’activité.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter deux sacs de sucre, un carton de thé de 12 paquets de 10 et  deux cartons de batterie un de grand modèle et un de petit modèle pour la vente.
   
Les bénéfices lui permettront en plus de renforcer son épargne de contribuer sensiblement aux frais scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
[This group] was created on May 17, 2011 at the inauguration of its banc villageois. Since then, the group has reached its seventh cycle in the banc villeagois loan program. The women in this group show solidarity and team spirit among themselves, which is acknowledged by village elders. The group members’ main activity is retail, manufacturing of traditional soup and rain-fed agriculture.
Mrs. Houleye (the one seated on the far right raising her right hand is a star borrower. She is 30 years old and the mother of three: two boys and one girl. She sels sugar, green tea, bouillon [stock] cubes, batteries for flashlights and miscellaneous items. She purchase her goods at the weekly market of her district wholesale and semi-wholesale in order to resell retail in her village. She has an experience of over five years in this business. This new loan will allow her to buy two bags of sugar, a box of tea bags containing 12 ten-packs  and two boxes of batteries, a large type and a small one, for resale.

Her revenues will allow her to bolster her savings and contribute meaningfully to the school fees and healthcare costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar, two boxes of green tea containing 12 ten-bag packs and two boxes with two varieties of batteries, for resale.

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es:
Ana tiene un pequeño restaurante en un local arrendado, desde allí ha intentado salir adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación preparando desayunos y almuerzos a las personas del municipio de La Dorada.
Es una mujer pujante y con gran sed de éxito.
Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de utensilios de cocina, insumos para sus preparaciones, sillas y mesas para abastecer su restaurante con inventario y utilería.
Estos elementos le darán un gran impulso económico y podrá continuar con su labor.
Su mayor motivación es su pequeño bebe de 6 meses a quien planea darle una excelente calidad de vida y procurara por brindarle siempre lo mejor.
texts.en:
Ana has a small restaurant in a rented space. She has been trying to get ahead there through hard work and dedication by preparing breakfasts and lunches for people in the town of La Dorada. 

She is a vigorous woman with a great thirst for success.

She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking utensils, ingredients for her preparations and chairs and tables to stock her restaurant with inventory and furnishings. These items will give her great economic momentum and she will be able to continue with her business. 

Her greatest motivation is her small 6 month old baby to whom she plans to give an excellent quality of life. She will always try to provide the best for her child.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils, supplies and chairs and tables.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Maria Teresa has been engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 40 years old and has three school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to earn a higher income in order to support the education of her children. 

With this in mind, she planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she wants to take a loan of 14,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Diana Miladis

texts.es:
Diana una joven con gran proyección de vida y laboral pues desde muy joven siempre la ha llamado la atención la comercialización de productos y se ha destacado por sus buenas habilidades para las ventas y cerrar negocios.
Es madre de 25 años de edad con dos hijos ambos menores de edad vive con su esposo y hace años empezó con un negocio pues no quería quedarse de barrios cruzados esperando que su esposo generara los ingresos para el hogar.
En su tienda comercializa dulces, gaseosas, víveres, productos de aseo y complementa sus ventas con prendas de vestir y productos de catálogo.
Siempre tiene miras al futuro y por eso quiere solicitar un crédito para crecer el cual invertirá en surtido, y la otra parte en estanterías y ampliar el local para hacerlo más organizado  y sectorizar su espacio. 
Con este crédito podrá tener su negocio más organizado y ofrecer una buena cantidad de productos lo cual es muy beneficioso para el sector pues en el corregimiento no hay muchos lugares donde oferten estos productos.
Sueña con tener un autoservicio donde pueda ofrecer varios empleos y  más importante darle empleo a su esposo para que deje el peligroso trabajo en minas de carbón.
texts.en:
Diana is a young woman with a high profile in life and work because since she was very young she was struck by the commercialization of products, and she has been noted by her great ability to sell and close deals. She is a 25-year-old mom, with two children who are both minors, and she lives with her husband.  Years ago, she opened a business because she did not want to stay with her arms crossed while her husband generated the house income. 

In her store she sells candy, sodas, groceries, cleaning products, and she complements her sales with clothing and catalog products. She is always looking towards the future, and that is why she is requesting a loan to grow. She will invest it purchasing assorted goods, and the other part in shelves to expand the store to make it more organized and divide its space. 

With this loan she will organize her store and offer a good amount of products, which is beneficial because in the town there are not many places where these products are offered.

She dreams of having an auto service where she can offer several jobs, and more importantly, give employment to her husband so that he quits his dangerous job in the coal mines.

loans.use: to purchase shelves, expand the business, and purchase assorted goods

loans.name: Mikongeni Group

texts.en:
Mona is a father of four children who are in school. He is in his early forties, supporting his family by running a grocery selling beers, sodas, waters, and spirits. He has been managing the business for three years now. Mona runs his business from 11 a.m. to after midnight and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is his first loan via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy grocery stocks of drinks (beers, sodas, and water). He dreams of expanding his grocery business. He will share this loan with his loan group "Mikongeni," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery stocks of drinks (beers, sodas, and water).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria previously accessed a 30,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 38,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Victoria dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. She is married and she has a son and a daughter; both of them are married and they live with their families. She graduated from Yerevan Economical College and she has a specialty in economics and accounting. For several years, she worked at a bank as an accountant, but it has already been ten years since she entered in the trading business. She sells women's clothes at a rented stall, and having a correspondence education, she successfully runs her business with not a bad income for her family. 

This will be Naira’s second Kiva loan, which she hopes, like the first one, will be useful and profitable for her trading business. Naira asks for this loan in order to buy and renew her stall’s summer season clothes collection with new, fashionable, and colorful women's dresses and skirts.

loans.use: to buy and renew her stall’s summer season clothes collection with new, fashionable, and colorful women's dresses and skirts.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He is an educated man. Recently, he has been an employee in the public sector. Over time, Mohammed was able to save a good amount of money from his salary and purchased a bus to work as a driver to transport people from one station to another to earn money in order to improve the living standards of his family. He has been in this business for many years. 

Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes to the repair of the bus. The repair of the bus costs him a lot of money. His taxi became very old and needs weekly repairing, but Mohammed doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 150,000 YER (Yemeni Rials) from AMB (Al-Amal Microfinance Bank) in order to buy spare parts for the bus and change its machine. These new spare parts will help him to save a lot of money.

Mohammed's vision is to repair this bus and sell it in order to purchase a new one in place of the first bus. He hopes to get a piece of land and to build a house on it.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus and change its machine.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 37 year-old married woman from Gaza. She is a mother of three sons and two daughters. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers the the family's needs. Rabab has a beauty salon in the city, which has been opened for the past two years. 
Rabab took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy beauty products she uses in her salon. By taking this loan, Rabab will be able to improve her salon and increase her productivity. 
Rabab appears in the photo in her salon

loans.use: to buy beauty products she uses in her salon.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
The previous loan of Jocelyn was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes that her business will continue to grow and prosper. She desires to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 48 years old, is a married male with 8 children, 6 of whom are attending school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in bicycle spare parts and he has been in that business for eight years. He practices farming, from which he gets additional income. Joseph wants money to buy more bicycle spare parts. Joseph dreams of expanding his business into a wholesale business. He is a hardworking person, however low capital is still a challenge he faces.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Estancia Vieja. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 5 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Carmen para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí prepara deliciosos platos pero solo en las tardes y noches, prepara meriendas y comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, corviches, empanadas, batidos y jugos naturales, lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Estancia Vieja communal bank meet in Estancia Vieja, which is located in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. The community is made up of humble people who work in agriculture and general commerce.This is where Carmen, 27, lives. She is married and has a 5-year-old son from this relationship who goes to school. Her husband works in agriculture.

Carmen started a business several years ago in order to help her husband with the household expenses, since what he earns isn't enough to cover the expenses. She has a small business in her house, where she prepares delicious dishes, but only in the afternoons and evenings. She prepares snacks and fast food, such as hamburgers, corviches, empanadas, shakes, and juices. She has been running this business for 3 years and it gives her what she needs to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare her dishes. She has been a member of her communal bank for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because of the help they give her to get ahead. Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Maritza, solicita nuevamente un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar maíz y tambien desea adquirir más pollos, ya que con el crédito anterior compro pollos para su granja y le fue muy bien.
texts.en: Maritza is again requesting a loan to purchase manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to cultivate corn; and she also wishes to acquire more chicken, because with the previous loan she bought chickens for her farm and she did very well.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to cultivate corn; and she also wishes to get more chickens

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 55 years old, married and has children. As a way of generating income, she has been engaged in a tailoring business within her community in Taguig, Philippines, for years now. She, together with her husband, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

She mainly offers lace, curtains and other home trappings. Seasonal demand for clothing like uniforms and such is available all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Marilou wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Marilou dreams that her business will continue to operate to help her provide for their needs. In the future, she dreams to have a peaceful and sufficient living with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, vive con sus padres, comenta que su familia tiene un negocio con el cual les ayuda a todos.
Está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, y comenta que ya está a punto de terminar, que está haciendo su tesis, que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido ir haciendo.
Él está esforzándose para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida por medio de sus estudios. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de tesis, que le será de mucha ayuda y con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the city of San Ignacio. He lives with his parents and says that his family has a business that has been a help to everyone.

Pedro is studying for a degree in Nutrition. He says that he is at the point of finishing, but is currently composing his thesis, which takes a great deal of effort to complete. Pedro is striving to grow through his studies so that he can become someone in life. He is requesting this loan so that he can cover his thesis expenses, which will be a great help since he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to pay his thesis expenses.

loans.name: Jael

texts.en:
Jael is a 30-year-old widow who has been blessed with three children and has been operating a clothing sales business for five years, earning an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Jael is now servicing her second loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to add more stock of second-hand clothes and curtain materials to sell to her customers. 

Jael plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and to open a clothing stall, and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To add more stock of curtains and second-hand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for sanitation expenses on her property.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 29 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y  sus dos hijos un niño de 10 años y una niña de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que se gana la vida por medio de un negocio domiciliar en el cual posee un molino de nixtamal en donde muchas personas solicitan sus servicios para moler variedad de semillas como: maíz, frijoles, arroz, café, etc. Carmen desea realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica y mejorar las paredes de su vivienda ya que actualmente son de adobe y esto genera focos de anidación de plagas por lo que es algo insalubre para su familia. Ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y pintura  para  repellar y pintar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is 29 years old and lives with her life companion and their two children, a 10-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who earns her living by managing a home-based business. Carmen has a grain mill and many people request milling services for a variety of products such as corn, beans, rice, coffee, and other items.

Carmen wants to have electricity installed and also improve the walls of her home. The walls are currently made of adobe, which can result in cracks where pests can nest and create an unhealthy situation for her family. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, and paint. Carmen plans to plaster and paint the walls of her home.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of an electricity connection and to buy cement, sand, and paint for repairing the walls of her home.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en:
Gulruhsor is a careful mother of two children. Her husband died some years ago. So, she is widowed. Gulruhsor has worked in a local hospital as a nurse for more than 11 years. She has a great experience in this field and does her job well. She always tries for the education of her children. 

Her daughter is a student of the first course. Gulruhsor must pay for the tuition of her daughter, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni to pay for the tuition of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition of her daughter

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to give her children a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma continua dedicándose a la artesanía, la socia vende chompas, gorros entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Imasumac II” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de polos, chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Vilma continues to manage her business involving handcrafted items. She sells sweaters, caps, and other products. Vilma has been at this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

Vilma is still a member of the Communal Bank “Imasumac II”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is requesting a loan in order to buy pullover shirts, sweaters, and other products. Vilma is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy pullover shirts, sweaters, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, cassava and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and two of them go to school. She takes care of one additional family member.

Aisha operates a beauty salon. She operates her business on a retail basis and works six days a week. Aisha has been in this business for the last 10 years. She also gets additional income from tailoring.

She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy braids, weaves, relaxers, treatments and shampoo. Her major challenges include seasonality and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her salon into a bridal center. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, treatments, shampoo and braids

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit lives happily in Kapan city in the Syunik region with his wife and 2-year-old pretty daughter. Davit is 30 years old.

For several years he worked at a private company and did different construction work. Now he is seriously engaged in farming. In a nearby village, Khdranc, he has a small and cute farm where he breeds 2 cows, 3 calves and 10 sheep. His farm’s product assortment is not great (from his farm he sells mainly milk and also some meat), but it is the only source of income for his young family, so that is why Davit spends much time and a lot of effort on the care of his farm cattle. He has a great desire in future to make it richer with cattle.

Now Davit needs this loan in order to buy a lot of hay for his farm cattle, the lack of which every farmer always has.

loans.use: to buy a lot of hay for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial press machine, corn, propane gas, wood, cloth, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general stock, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted drinks and pure water to expand her business

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a single mother of five children and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 9 years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, rice, flour, beans and beef. She works at the market six days every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulters and transportation.  She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to own a fully stocked restaurant.

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire additional capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, flour and beans

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 42-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother of four sons. Her husband has a stall where he sells candy in the city. Randa started her own business, which is a sewing workshop. She opened it in a small room in her house. She deals with local traders.
 
Randa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. By taking this loan, Randa will be able to increase her productivity with a better quality. 

Randa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: New Star Group

texts.en:
Jenitha, a businesswoman and a mother of four school-age kids, is in her thirties. She is married and supporting her family with two businesses: a meat butcher and a bar selling soft drinks, beers and spirits. She has been managing her enterprise since 2008 and is able to make a good profit each month. Jenitha starts business at 6 a.m. and goes until after midnight.

She will share this loan with her loan group "New Star," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

She is requesting her first loan via Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy stocks of meat and drinks for her bar.  Jenitha dreams that one day she will be able to make her business well known.

loans.use: to buy stock of meat and drinks for her bar

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who goes to school. She has no additional family members. For the last 5 years, Sandra has been selling used clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis, moving from door-to-door to sell her clothes. She works six  days a week.

Sandra has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes to sell. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Sandra's goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base to grow her business. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Yesu Tsui Krong Group

texts.en:
The Yesu Tsui Krong (Christ pure heart) Group is made up of five women who all live in the same neighborhood in Ghana. They are into selling cutlery sets, sugar cane, fridges, eggs and general goods.

Leticia is the group representative. She is 66 years old and married to Samuel. Together, they have three children who are all grown up. Leticia and Samuel live together, and both provide for the expenses of their household. Leticia left school at the secondary level and has been selling sugar cane for 18 years now. She is very successful with her business which allows her to provide for her family's needs. She buys sugar cane from the farmers and sells to customers.

She would like to be able to respond better to the demands of her customers, so she has requested this sixth loan, with the other members of Yesu Tsui Krong, from the field partner. This loan will enable them to fulfill their customers' needs and make more profit. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane from the farmers and sell to customers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn runs her eatery within her local community. She also has a hog raising business. Marilyn is married and has four children. Her spouse is a farmer. The couple both work hard to earn a living.

Marilyn would like to take out a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy various kinds of vegetables, raw pork meat, chicken and fish to sell. She hopes that her business will continue to grow continuously so she can sustain her family's basic needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of vegetables, raw pork meat, chicken and fish to sell

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda, 38 years old, has managed her small farm for almost 10 years. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Ayda's husband works as  a driver. They are blessed with two children. 

Due to lack of capital for use in her agricultural business, Ayda would like to access a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She hopes that her farm will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income with which to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.en: Husnigul was born in 1982. She is divorced and is a responsible mother of 2 children. Husnigul has been busy selling fabrics for some years in a local market for women. She is now selling summer season fabrics. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni (TJS) to buy fabrics for the new summer season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for the new summer season

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin, 35 years old, married an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has 2 children. Elchin is very happy with all of the help he received from Kiva lenders and thanks you a lot. 

Elchin and his wife work in agriculture. For 10 years, they have grown vegetables. Now it is time to plant the next crop and Elchin needs to buy seed and fertilizer. Since finances are tight, he has requested a loan of 600 AZN. He has high hopes for support. In the future, Elchin's family plans to rent one additional hectare of land and thus grow more crops.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever es estudiante y trabajador, busca graduarse para llevar a cabo una vida más satisfactoria, y el estudio o la contabilidad le va a ayudar a lograrlo porque cada día quiere ir superándose.
Ever está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y así ir creciendo como persona y profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y así seguir sus estudios como lo esta haciendo.
texts.en:
Ever is a working student. He is looking to graduate so that he can experience a more fulfilling life. The study of accounting will help him accomplish his goal because he wants to excel with each passing day.

Ever is studying for a degree in Accounting, which will help him to grow as a person and as a professional. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his fees, which will allow him to continue his studies as before.

loans.use: to pay his fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Toma

texts.en:
Toma, 51 years old, lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Toma has vocational education in the nursing profession, but she never worked as a nurse. She now works at the bread baking factory as a baker. Toma is married and has two sons and a daughter. Her elder son and daughter are married and they live separately with their families. Her younger son still lives with his parents. 

Toma’s husband is also employed but lately he has been feeling weak and unhealthy. He had a medical examination and found out that he has problems with his health and needs to undergo an urgent course of treatment. Toma greatly needs this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to pay for her husband's medical treatment.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's medical treatment

loans.name: Feras Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Feras Al-Hodeidah. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

Fotom is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with them in a poor area in Hodeidah, Yemen. In 2006, Fotom established her Sambusa (traditional food) business. She began her business because she didn't attend school as her parents didn't value providing an education to girls. Her mother introduced her to the business. When she got married, her husband gave her some money to start the business. She works seven days a week and fifteen hours a day. Fotom would like a loan in the amount of 30,000 YER from AMB. She requires a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, milk and other materials to make Sambusa and sell to the customers.

In the future, Fotom hopes to open a small shop to sell Sambusa. The loan will help her to generate more income and improve her family's standard of living. She is hardworking and ambitious.
