loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and other materials to make Sambusa.

loans.name: Rodelio

texts.en: Rodelio is married and has two school-aged children. He is from the village of Bagakay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Rodelio operates a motor transportation services business. He has been in this services business for more than four years, and he has successfully repaid his previous loan used for repairs. Hopeful to improve the business, he took another loan recently to buy new tires in order to replace the old used tires. It helps to ensure safety of the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets, plastic chairs and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su esposo de 37 años de edad y su hija de 13 años de edad; es propietaria de una mini ferretería, que administra junto a su esposo, el negocio funciona desde hace 3 años, atienden al público de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., lo aprendió de su hermano.
Necesita el capital para surtir el inventarió con materiales que sus clientes necesitan, comprara mangueras, tubos, cables, clavos, tornillos, desatornilladores, etc., le ayudar a mejorar su negocio, incrementar sus ventas e ingresos los cuales le sarán de utilidad para cubrir sus compromisos económicos.
Su sueño es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, cubrir las necesidades de su familia y apoyar a su hija en su educación.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her 37-year-old husband  and her 13-year-old daughter; She owns a mini hardware store, which she manages jointly with her husband. The store has been in business for three years and is open from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. She learned from her brother how to run the business. 

Sonia needs the  loan to stock her inventory with products in demand by her customers, including hoses, pipes, cables, nails, screws, screwdrivers, etc., This will help improve her business, increase both sales and profits which will be useful to cover her financial commitments. 

Her dream is to continue to strengthening her business, cover the needs of her family and support her daughter in her education.

loans.use: buy hoses, pipes, cables, nails, screws, screwdrivers etc.

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es:
Raúl, utilizo el préstamo anterior para comprar la materia prima para elaborar comida rápida como tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, etc., su economía se ha logrado estabilizar, da a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y cancelo su deuda, ya cuenta con otro rubro como lo es el transporte de escolares en microbús.
El capital que requiera le será de ayuda para comprar llantas nuevas y pagar el tapizado de su unidad de transporte, así ofrecerá viajes con mayor comodidad y seguridad. Espera lograr buenos resultados con dicha inversión.
texts.en:
Raúl used his previous loan to buy supplies for preparing fast food such as sandwiches, tacos, hamburgers, and other dishes. His finances stabilized and his family experiences a better lifestyle. Raúl paid off his debt and entered into another type of business, providing school transportation services with the use of a minibus.

The capital that he needs will be used to buy new tires and to have his vehicle upholstered. This will enable him to provide safer and more comfortable trips. Raúl hopes to achieve good results from this investment.

loans.use: to buy new tires and to have his vehicle upholstered.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 26 years old and married to Siliviah, and they are blessed with one child who is two years old. He runs a barber shop and has also sold coffee to his customers for the last seven years. He earns an income of 15,000 KES. He applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan to buy a modern shaving machine and renovate the business room by painting it.

The profit he earns will be used to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a modern shaving machine and renovate the business room by painting it.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with four children, and all of them go to school. She  has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. 

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, peas and flour. Her major challenges include thieves and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to diversify her business and also concentrate on farming. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, sugar, salt, beans, peas and flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una persona que se esta destacando por el esfuerzo y el sacrificio de ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio del estudio, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar sus gastos de clases, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a person who is known for her efforts and sacrifice. She expects to improve her living conditions as a result of her studies. Gladys said that her previous loan was used to pay her class expenses, which was a great help.

She is requesting this new loan in order to pay her university fees. This will allow her to continue working as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 27-year-old single lady who has been working in a photography business since March 2013. She is a single lady and the sole earner in her family responsible for three other members. 

Her business is going on just fine, but just like every business, you have to update within a certain period of time, Zeinab is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an updated, newly released camera necessary for her business development.

Zeinab is well-known in her region with the special talents she has, and customer service she provides.

She is an ambitious lady who works hard for her social and economical development.

She hopes to keep on developing her business to make sure she can improve her living.

loans.use: To buy an updated, newly released camera necessary for her business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy avocados to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Yakob Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yakob Al- Hodeidah. It consists of four women. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB. 

The president of the group is Fozia. She is 33 years old and a married woman. She works in selling ice cream and some kinds of sandwiches in the streets under sunshine to the schoolchildren. She decided to work in this humble business in order to help her husband in covering the expenses of the family. Most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. 

For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy ice cream materials as sugar and other materials in order to make the ice cream and sell it, and in this way, she will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is lack of capital. She faces many challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

Fozia looks forward to expanding her business through opening a stall for selling ice cream and children's sweets. She hopes to provide her children with a secure future. She hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream materials such as sugar and other materials in order to make the ice cream and sell it

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
La socia Yeny continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de Cds y Dvds,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como cds.
La socia Yeny agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yeny continues to operate her business of selling CDs and DVDs. She has been in this business for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Yeny wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family. She is a responsible and industrious person.

Yeny is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as CDs. She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as CDs.

loans.name: Yorisra Al

texts.en: Yorisra is a candidate student for the Academi Maritim Nusantara (AMN) who will study Commercial Shipping and Harbor Management. Yorisra is living in the interior of Borneo, in the city of Tarakan, North Borneo. Yorisra just graduated from high school and wants to continue her studies in AMN. Yorisra's father works only as an honorary teacher at a school in the city and her mother is raising pigs for sale to help meet the needs of her husband and her family's everyday needs. Parental income is minimal so Yorisra is experiencing concern that she may not continue her studies. Yorisra is the first child of five siblings. The younger siblings attend school. With these conditions, Yorisra does not want to bother her parents, because their income is uncertain. She is eager to get a loan from Kiva to help pay for college at AMN so that she can finish her studies and get a job quickly to help her younger siblings in order to attend school, in accordance with the expectations of her parents.

loans.use: to pay her education fees for three years

loans.name: Lakshmi

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a young woman of 31 years from Dhupguri.  She is married and lives with her husband Chatura and four daughters, three of whom are students who are in grades 8, 6 and 4. Their elder daughter stays at home and helps her mother with household work.  Lakshmi has a primary education and her husband studied until grade two. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud) in Kalirhat, a small village in Jalpaiguri district.

Lakshmi's husband is a farmer by profession who has a plot of cultivable land.  He works hard to come out ahead in vegetable cultivation. He has several years of experience working on his farm.  His products are in much demand in the markets. Lakshmi is an energetic and hardworking woman.  She greatly supports her husband in his work after finishing her household jobs. The income of the family depends entirely on this agricultural activity, so she and her partner want to develop it by growing paddy.  Being the main food for the people of her locality, rice is in great demand in the market. So they hope it will be a lucrative business for them to strengthen their family's economy.

Lakshmi applied for a loan from BJS, which she will use to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things.  Her dreams are to support her children in their studies, improve their quality of life and continue strengthening family assets.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing paddy.

loans.name: Mamina

texts.en:
Mamina lives in a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 34 years old and a housewife.  She lives with her two children (one son and one daughter) and her husband Nazrul, 49 years old, who is a farmer.  Mamina and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. But they are providing an education to their children who are in grade 10 and grade 8.  They have a small kachha house (mud, wood and straw made).

Mamina's husband has an agricultural farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons.  He is visionary and focused. He has been involved in this business for seven years.  He struggles hard to grow quality vegetables to satisfy his customers.  His land is very fertile and productive.  His primary customers are individuals.  Mamina, though a housewife, helps her husband a lot by sowing, planting and carrying the produce to the market. But the income from the business is very scant. They need to expand their business in order to cope with the increasing expenses of their family.  But their main challenge is capital.

So Mamina has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to cultivate bitter gourd on their farmland.  She wants to use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs to start the cultivation.

Her goals are to strengthen their family's economy and provide a better education to her children so that they become professional in the future.

She thanks her lenders for helping by giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate bitter gourd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cables, memory cards, USB connectors, keyboards, hard disks, CDs, CPUs, and other devices.

loans.name: Marybel De Lourdes

texts.es: Marybel siendo madre soltera está luchando a diario para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la actividad comercial de venta de comida variada todos los fines de semana, su primer crédito lo destino para mejorar una pared de su vivienda y ahora lo solicita para comprar materiales de construcción como laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, arena, hierro para hacer posible la construcción de un cuarto que le asignara a sus hijos permitiendo su privacidad, de esta manera va mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Being a single mother, Marybel strives each day to help her children get ahead. She sells various types of food on the weekends. Her first loan was used to improve one of the walls of her house.

She is now requesting a loan for buying construction materials such as zinc sheets, blocks, cement, sand, and iron in order to build a room that will be designated for her children. This will give them privacy and also improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a room for her children.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde hace que termino sus estudios se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 1 año inicio con un negocio de billares y juegos de azar en el municipio de Medellín.
Es un negocio bastante popular en el sector y se ha convertido en punto de encuentro para jóvenes y adultos.
Con tan poco tiempo en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Carlos.
El solicita un préstamo para realizar una mejora locativa en la parte donde tiene ubicadas las mesas de billar ya que quiere hacerla mucho más atractiva y cómoda para sus clientes, además desea comprar surtido de bebidas, licores y frituras para aumentar sus ventas.
El ofrece trabajo a un primo y desea generar otros empleos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man with great drive and entrepreneruship. Ever since he finished his studies, he was determined to find a business that would generate good income for him and would allow him to be independent.  This is how he began one year ago with a business of billiards and games of chance in the municipality of Medellín.

It is quite a popular business in the district, and it has become a meeting point for youth and adults.

With so little time in the market, he already has a certain level of recognition, thanks to his good management.

He is applying for a loan to improve the premises in the area where the billiard tables are located, since he wants to make it much more attractive and comfortable for his customers. In addition, he wants to buy a stock of beverages, liquors, and fried foods to increase his sales.

He offers employment to a cousin and wants to generate other positions.

loans.use: to make improvements in his business premises and buy a stock of beverages, liquors, and fried foods

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cueles son siete de 22, 19, 17, 15, 13, 10 y 5 años de edad, siendo muy joven tomo como herencia de sus padres la crianza de ganado, cerdos y cultivo de granos básicos, ya cuenta con más de 10 años de hacerlo de manera independiente, su familia lo apoya en las diferentes jornadas de trabajo. Su ventaja es que las propiedades en las que trabaja le pertenecen.
El capital que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, semillas, insecticidas y concentrado para ganado y cerdos, teniendo estos materiales eliminara la maleza, ampliara y dará un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos.
Su visión es seguir trabajando para tener recursos económicos con los que mejore la alimentación, vestuario, educación, salud y  pueda cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and children, of whom there are seven, ages 22, 19, 17, 15, 13, 10, and 5. He was very young when he undertook, as a legacy from his parents, the raising of cattle and pigs and the cultivation of basic grains. He already has more than 10 years of experience doing this independently. His family helps him with the various daily tasks. His advantage is that the properties on which he works belong to him.

He will invest the capital that he needs in the purchase of compost, fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, insecticides, and concentrated feed for cattle and pigs. Having these materials will eliminate the weeds and will increase and give good development to his crops.

His vision is to continue working in order to have economic resources with which he can improve the feeding , clothing, education, and health [of his family] and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, insecticides, and concentrated feed for cattle and pigs

loans.name: Myanaka Bala

texts.en:
Myanaka Bala is a 50-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Dhupguri.  Her family consists of her husband and three sons.  They live in their small kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).  Her husband Lalchand, age 60, is a farmer by profession.  Both are uneducated and can only sign their names.  Due to poverty, they could not provide a proper education to their children.  One is a student in grade 9, but the other two are grown up and work as laborers on a daily wages basis.

The income from her husband's agribusiness is too scant to cover all the necessary expenses of the family.  Her sons have also inconsistent incomes.  So, to provide a better living, Myanaka Bala has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last four years.  She started her business with the purchase of one cow.  She supplies milk to her neighbors and earns income for her family. Now this business provides a strong financial support to the family.  As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can generate more income.  She has decided to purchase one more cow and start a milk products business (such as curd, butter, paneer etc.).

For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to be able to purchase a dairy cow that will be of great help to her in terms of getting more milk for her business.  Through the loan, she will be able to fulfill her dream of selling milk products to her neighbors and the village around her where demand for these products is very high.

She wants to save money to build a better and decent house for them in the future with the profit from her business and she is very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is 41 years old.  She is from Dhupguri.  She is married, a housewife and is blessed with two daughters.  She and her husband are providing education to their daughters, who read in different levels of secondary school.  Purnima and her husband both are uneducated because of their parental poverty.

Purnima's husband Niranjan, age 43, is a cycle-van puller by profession (a kind of transport widely used in rural West Bengal). He has been transporting people and goods to different places inside as well as outside of his village.  With the income that he earns, he helps his family with household expenses. It is going well for him because he is dedicated to his job, responsible and transports his clients and goods safely. Unfortunately, recently his van met with an accident and was severely damaged.  Being the only breadwinner for the family, he is now unable to earn income and the family has acute financial problems. He immediately needs to buy a new cycle-van.

So Purnima asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help her husband by purchasing a new van.  He will continue working with the same determination and enthusiasm and will improve his family's quality of life.

Purnima wants to use the profit to admit her sons into a renowned school and save money for the future to construct a decent and better house for them.

She appreciates the help of her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband .

loans.name: Juana Del Tráncito

texts.es:
Juana ya es cliente kiva, anteriormente solicito un crédito, el que aprovecho de muy buena manera, ya que el negocio ha ido incrementado considerablemente. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar cinco docenas de pantalones para caballero, tres docenas de camisas de vestir, ya que anteriormente no vendía ropa para hombre, el mejoramiento que el préstamo le dará es el poder ofrecerles más variedad a los clientes, la necesidad satisfecha será el comprar por mayor  donde esto le genera un ahorro en sus compras y  una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Juana is already a Kiva client. She previously requested a loan, which she used wisely; the business has been growing considerably.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of five dozen pairs of men's trousers and three dozen dress shirts. Since she previously did not sell clothing for men, the improvement that the loan will give her is the power to offer more variety to her clients, and the need that will be satisfied is the ability to buy wholesale as this will generate savings when she makes her purchases and therefore a greater profit.

loans.use: to buy five dozen pairs of men's trousers and three dozen dress shirts, as she previously did not sell men's clothing

loans.name: Jo-Ann

texts.en:
Jo-Ann is dedicated to her studies and wants to become successful in the future. She studies for a B.S. in education in a university. Her parents earn a living through vending. To pay her tuition fee for the first semester, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit. She had joined GDMPC recently to gain access to its services.

She is determined that in the future, she will find a better job according to her ambitions.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, bread and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sonsón desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Lina y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.
Lina desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera mas cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Lina is a humble and hard-working woman who has spent a large part of her life looking after her children. She lives in the municipality of Sonsón, where she works spectacularly well in the kitchen as she has her own business making meals to order, such as tamales, chorizos, and empanadas.

She mainly sells this food to residents of the area who know the taste of Lina’s food and that they will always get delicious and well-prepared food from her.

Lina wishes to increase her food sales and work in a more comfortable manner. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase some cooking utensils and supplies so she can continue making her recipes.

This loan will enable her to get ahead in her business so she can obtain the necessary earnings to continue feeding and clothing her family.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies for her business

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra ya se le tramito un primer crédito con la línea kiva, donde se vio la mejora,  ya que compro la plancha que utiliza para elaborar toda su venta.

Ahora necesita el crédito para comprar  harina  de maíz, ya que está migrando a vender pupusas, un plato muy típico en el país, también comprara unas mesas y sillas para que los clientes puedan estar cómodos. La mejora que tendrá con el préstamo es el poder tener materia prima para su negocio y la compra de la mueblería.
 
Su propósito, es seguir con  las ventas y  crecer la clientela, tener una estabilidad mejor, espera que el negocio siempre vaya en aumento, con lo que le ayudara a poder tener su propio capital de trabajo, las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Sandra has already had her first loan with Kiva, and she saw an improvement from it since she bought the grill she uses to make everything she sells.

She now needs a loan to buy cornmeal, since she is going to sell pupusas [stuffed tortillas], which are a very traditional type of food in El Salvador. She will also buy some tables and chairs so that her clients can be comfortable. The improvement this loan will bring is that she will be able to have raw material for her business and buy furniture.

Her goal is to continue with her sales, increase her clientele, and have greater stability. She hopes that the business always continues to grow, which will help her to be able to have her own working capital. The profits will be invested in paying off her loan and her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, since she is going to sell pupusas (traditional dish of El Salvador). She will also buy some tables and chairs so her clients can be comfortable.
